Requisition ID: 69377 Job Description We are looking for a student who is available to work from January 2023 - June 2023. The responsibilities will include: Analog circuit design, simulation, verification, and production ramp support of highly integrated, high volume ICs for high-growth, fast-paced, and competitive wireless handset market. Knowledge of RF circuit experience a plus. Familiarity with cellular standards will be useful. The candidate must be able to work well with other design engineers, system engineers and CAD layout designers. Requirements Must be currently enrolled in an Electrical Engineering BS or MS (preferred) program We will not consider students who have already graduated Knowledge of semiconductors, analog circuits and RF design fundamentals. Understanding of basic analog IC building blocks like bias, bandgap, LDO, op-amp, etc. Understanding of design parameters like gain, noise, non-linearity, stability, etc. Exposure to a lab testing setup and environment including commonly used test equipment like network analyzer, spectrum analyzer, frequency generator and etc. Familiarity and experience with circuit design tools like Cadence and be familiar with CMOS/bipolar/SOI devices and models. Use of Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel is required to perform job duties successfully. Position requires good communication and presentation skills. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 67016 Summary The successful candidate will be responsible for the design and development of BAW/SAW filters for standalone and integrated products. The candidate will work with a group of domestic and international filter designers performing modeling, filter design, and device characterization. This includes presentation of design reviews which are expected to demonstrate compliance to the specifications using simulation and measured results. The Filter designers will work closely with power amplifier (PA) designers, RF switch designers, systems engineers, and other module design engineers to co-design RF modules products. Responsibilities The filter design engineer’s responsibilities will include but not be limited to the following: Designing BAW- and SAW-based duplexers, quadplexers, and other filters for broad market applications Designing evaluation boards and RF modules or portions thereof for optimal filter performance Electromagnetic modeling of filters in their module environment Filter integration into front end modules Utilizing design of experiments (DOE) and other experimental methods to improve filter performance and model correlation Laying out photo masks and completing necessary documentation for filter fabrication Assembling, measuring, deembedding, and reporting on the performance of filters and filter modules Participating in and conducting design reviews Software Tools Used Include Ansys HFSS and Mechanical Keysight ADS and Momentum Cadence SIP and Virtuoso Matlab Various custom filter design and modeling applications Requirements Possess a broad understanding of RF analog component performance characterization via Smith Chart, tuning via passives, etc). Understand basic device physics and have the ability to use advanced modeling techniques to design filters. Strong skills in EM modeling and RF simulation tools (HFSS, Cadence, ADS, AWR, etc.). Strong communication skills, able to break down complex problems, set priorities, report progress, and execute to a schedule. BSEE and 11 years related experience, or MSEE and 8 years experience or Ph.D. and 6 years experience with a focus on RF, SAW, BAW, or PiezoMEMS discipline. Experience in RFIC design, SAW/BAW Filter Design, or RF module and front-end system design is a plus. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

jobTitle: Advanced Ceramic Materials Research and Development Summer 2023 Intern
jobDescription: If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. Requisition ID: 69739 Summary Skyworks RF Ceramics is in Adamstown, Maryland and specializes in the development of oxide ceramic materials for the wireless infrastructure, aerospace and energy markets. The primary focus is on oxide magnetic and dielectric materials for the wireless infrastructure market. The RF Ceramics group is part of the Diversified Analog Solutions division of Skyworks. As an Advanced Ceramic Materials Research and Development Intern you will work with the R&D engineering team in developing new formulations for ceramic materials to address customer needs in the markets described above. This position involves the development of new ceramic materials from working with the engineering team to identify promising candidate chemistries, working with the R&D synthesis technicians to synthesize ceramic materials of the identified chemistry and phase contents and to assist in characterizing the properties of the synthesized ceramic materials. In addition, other aspects of the position will be to improve existing materials in production through an enhanced understanding of the effects of chemistry, phase content and microstructure on the properties of the ceramic material. Responsibilities The candidate will work with R&D group engineers devising ceramic synthesis experiments to evaluate promising candidate material chemistries. The candidate will work with engineers in the R&D group and the quality department on measuring the properties of synthesized materials. The candidate will work with engineers in the R&D group and the Process Engineering group to analyze production data with the goal of improving existing materials. Requires a strong background in inorganic or solid-state chemistry and ceramic processing. Good data summary and presentation skills are desired. Job Requirements University Student Candidate must be currently enrolled in a BS, MS, or PhD Materials Science, Materials Engineering (or related) degree program. Must be able and available to work starting May 2023 to August 2023. Basic knowledge of Ceramic Processing, Ceramic Characterization and Solid State Chemistry. Ability to use Microsoft Office suite Preferred Skills Familiarity with Statistical Data Analysis software like JMP Familiarity with basic ceramic powder processing techniques Familiarity with standard ceramic forming techniques including uniaxial and isostatic pressing Familiarity with the operation of electric kilns Familiarity with ceramic characterization techniques such as particle size and surface area analysis for powders, dilatometry, and x-ray diffraction. Why Join Us? We passionately believe that by working at Skyworks Solutions, you will be joining the brightest, most diverse and ambitious talent in the Semiconductor Industry. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together can change the way the world communicates. Requisition ID: 69400 Job Description Join our team developing high performance Silicon Analog IC solutions for next-generation mobile applications! Document and present your work to a broad audience of co-workers. This is an excellent opportunity to expand your peer network to launch a career in this important field. Located in Silicon Valley amongst major customers, the Skyworks San Jose Design Center is seeking motivated individuals eager to join a winning team in the competitive mobile communications market. With a headcount over 100, the San Jose Design Center comprises of tightly-knot, diverse, and multi-cultural teams of 4 to 8 members. Every team is guided by the core principles of sharing, openness, collaboration, accountability, and trust. Personally contribute to the realization of RF Front-End integrated circuits used in mobile phones from initial concept to final production, whether your specialty is in multi-chip modules, power amplifiers, RFICs or PMICs, RF filters, Validation, Test, Product Engineering, or Assembly. See your valuable inputs directly translate into new ways of solving common problems, improved design methodology, or enhanced business culture or the work environment. Join us to experience all aspects of highly integrated semiconductor, module, and embedded RF circuits design, our in-house prototype Assembly lab capable of building fully packaged samples, and our world-class RF characterization laboratory. Job Responsibilities Working with a mentor and within a design team, the intern will participate in the design and development of CMOS and SOI Analog Integrated Circuit designs for mobile handset applications. The candidate will work within a group of Analog/RF IC design experts, interfacing with both local and remote design engineers to identify and solve circuit problems, simulate and implement schematic-level solutions, verify electrical performance, and possibly even participate in a Silicon tapeout. Qualifications And Education Requirements Must be a student, enrolled in a university making forward process towards a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, returning to the academic program following Skyworks intern assignment. Available to work full time from May - August 2023. Solid understanding of Silicon process technology, including device physics, electrical transistor models, physical implementation, and measured device performance. Solid fundamentals in the design and operation of bandgaps, op-amps, regulators, current mirrors, basic logic synthesis, and stability. Understanding of device matching, on-chip layout circuit techniques, ESD, and latch-up. Experience in simulations tools, preferably Cadence, as well as Analog circuit test techniques and equipment. Good communication skills, ability to break down complex problems, set priorities, report progress, and execute to a schedule. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

jobTitle: Analog Mixed-Signal IC Design Summer 2023 Intern
jobDescription: If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together can change the way the world communicates. Requisition ID: 69658 Job Description Analog Mixed-Signal IC Design Summer 2023 Intern About The Business Unit Come join our world class mixed-signal design team for an internship. We are a part of the Diversified Analog Solutions group at Skyworks. Our specific group focuses on the design of SoCs for wired and wireless audio applications. Join a diversified team primarily located in Portland, OR. Position Summary This position is for an Analog Mixed-Signal Integrated Circuit Design Intern. Be mentored while contributing to an SoC design. This is intended to be a design internship where the work will be scaled to the intern’s experience and internship length. Possible topics for a design internship include ADC/DACs for either audio or RF applications, reference or clock generation, RF TX or RX front-end design. The goal of this internship is to provide the recipient with real world experience working with a team during the design of an SoC. The actual topic of the design is flexible and will involve some input from the intern on their desired project. This is a collaborative internship for a highly motivated student. Responsibilities You will work with a dedicated team of engineers, contributing to the design and/or verification of a mixed-signal SoC. As an intern, you will be exposed to the tools and workflow of our team. Tasks can include close communication with designers and team, creation of blocks based on specifications, development of specifications, simulation verification of a design, and physical verification of a design. The intern will be expected to present their results, in both meetings and a final design document. This will serve both to guide the intern on their project and overcome any challenges that occur. Qualification & Education Requirements You should be enrolled in a graduate degree program (Master or PhD) with a focus on the design of integrated circuits. Preferred Skills Running spice simulations Cadence IC Design environment Tapeout experience Chip Testing Experience Cadence IC Design environment Why join us? We passionately believe that by working at Skyworks Solutions, you will be joining the brightest, most diverse and ambitious talent in the Semiconductor Industry. You will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on execution, global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Requisition ID: 66399 Job Description Seeking an experienced Analog/Power IC design engineer for developing complex analog mixed signal/integrated power management ICs for Industrial Control, Industrial Power, Isolation, and other Infrastructure applications. This design group is at the forefront of the EV revolution, working to develop technologies that will revolutionize vehicles and enable new levels of power efficiency. The position requires a solid analog circuit design background including a history of innovative design. The desired individual will participate in product definition, design, and verification. The individual will have a role in implementing the overall system architecture, designing transistor-level analog circuit blocks, simulating sub-system performance, creating and using behavioral models of blocks and the entire IC, doing and/or supervising physical layout and verifying circuit and chip-level operation and performance. Responsibilities will also include detailed documentation, silicon evaluation and debugging, production test development support, customer support, and other activities as required to achieve high volume production. Responsibilities Architects, designs and verifies circuits, systems, algorithms, etc. to meet product requirements Develops innovative new designs for patenting or protecting as trade secrets Balancing innovation with execution to ensure that the projects are delivered in a timely manner Demonstrates good judgment in solving a broad range of issues Responsible for custom layout including overseeing the work of layout designers Reports on design results through design reviews Attends design reviews to provide input and learn from other designers’ experiences Research design techniques through technical publications and seminars Experience Preferred Educational Background BSEE + 5 years experience MSEE + 3 years experience PhD EE + 0 years experience Minimum Requirements Advanced knowledge of MOS transistors and analog circuit design Knowledge of complex AC/DC analysis (poles, zeros, compensation), loop dynamics and feedback systems Knowledge of device physics and CMOS/BiCMOS fabrication processes Previous design experience with complex mixed signal design problems Knowledge in signals, systems and transforms Understanding of the end to end design flow from product definition to high volume manufacturing Understanding of layout tradeoffs for performance and size Strong background in analog signal chain solutions Strong knowledge of circuit simulation tools, layout verification tools, modeling tools, and UNIX Additional Skills (one or more of these are highly desirable) Knowledge of high voltage processes and design in BCD and/or SOI type processes Previous design experience with integrated power conversion circuits (DC-DC/Power converters, charge-pumps, LDO’s, rectifiers, amplifiers) MOS Device modeling skills (noise, excess thermal noise, DIBL) Laboratory measurement skills System knowledge (e.g., isolators) and design skills in system modeling Understanding of mixed signal solutions including discrete time digital signal processing Good written and verbal presentation skills Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69515 Job Description This IC design co-op will work closely with CMOS and SOI design engineers in the layout and verification of RF and analog integrated circuits for wireless mobile consumer electronic products. The analog team focuses on design and tapeout of analog IP including charge-pumps, LDO regulators, fuse circuitry, and high-speed digital interfaces. Our RF designers focus on high-performance, high-power RF switching arrays, couplers, RF attenuators, harmonic filters, matching networks, EM analysis, and correlating simulation and lab measurement. Position requires remote interfacing with domestic and international design engineering and layout teams, in multiple design centers, across multiple time zones. The internship is based at our Cedar Rapids, IA design center. Job Requirements Currently enrolled in a BS or MS program studying Electrical Engineering Must be returning to school following the Co-Op Able to commit to the Summer/Fall 2023 Co-Op Program which goes from July - December 2023 Familiar with Cadence, SPICE, or similar simulation tools to assist in design evaluation and debugging of Op Amps, Voltage References, ADC’s, etc. Completed coursework in Analog CMOS design Exposure to lab tools such as Oscilloscope, Function Generator, Multimeter etc. Excellent communication (both written and verbal), organization, and documentation skills Must have experience with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word Ideally, experience working on a small team and presenting knowledge to peers Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69417 Job Description Skyworks is a prominent semiconductor and technology company that is empowering the wireless networking revolution, connecting people, places, and things around the world. We are looking for a current student who is available to work full-time in our Hillsboro, Oregon office as part of our summer 2023 internship program. You will be working with our AI group to help research and develop cutting-edge speech and signal processing algorithms on edge devices. As part of this team, you will share responsibility for some of the following tasks: Development of neural networks. Analyze neural network efficiency and performance. Optimize neural networks using a variety of techniques including weight pruning and quantization Port to and test neural networks on microprocessors and other constrained devices. Develop neural network based real-time audio algorithms Research state of the art neural networks in the audio domain Job Requirements Many of the following skills will be necessary for success in this role: Experience with at least one deep learning framework (preferable Tensorflow) Understanding of common neural network layer types and their mathematical operations Development of algorithms that are optimized for both memory and computational efficiency Programming in Python and C/C++ (preferably experience with embedded programming) Knowledge of bit level representations for integer and float types Conceptual understanding of computer architecture, memory and caching Familiarity with audio/speech/music signals Proficient in Linux (Ubuntu) Desire to write clean, maintainable code Qualifications And Education Requirements Must be enrolled as a degree seeking student. No courses should be taken during the internship unless required by your school. Preferable enrolled in a master's or PhD program in a STEM related field that involves programming (e.g. Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics). Bachelor students will be considered if they have professional experience or personal projects applying neural networks to solve complex programs, and/or advanced embedded programming. Why join us? Job Description Audio DSP Engineer Internship - Summer 2023 About Skyworks AIS At Skyworks AIS, we work together to deliver highly integrated and innovative ICs and Firmware for consumer audio. You can expect to gain familiarity with many aspects of audio processing development in a focused and collaborative environment. You will be able to take pride in your work on products that will be available to consumers worldwide. Position Summary When you join our world-class Audio DSP engineering team, you’ll work on creating and characterizing advanced audio signal processing features such as Active Noise Cancellation, Echo Cancellation, Microphone Beamforming, Noise Suppression and more. These features run on Skyworks custom-designed ICs embedded in consumer audio devices, including wireless and wired headsets, earbuds, conferencing systems, and home audio systems. Responsibilities You will be involved with hands-on development of Audio DSP, including the following responsibilities and activities: Develop and implement new Audio DSP methods and features using computer simulation and/or real-time embedded systems Evaluate performance of Audio features and present findings Work with SDK and Application FW groups to integrate new Audio DSP methods Qualification and Education Requirements Enrolled in a BS program in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science. Interest in Audio signal processing Preferred Skills Knowledge of sampled data systems (ADCs, DACs), and audio signal processing (filters, FFTs, etc) Familiarity with C/C++ and Python languages. Matlab a plus. Basic understanding of embedded processors, firmware development and debugging. Experience with embedded systems a plus. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Oscilloscope, spectrum analyzer, network analyzer, signal generator, GPIB, Rhode&Schwarz, Audio Precision) Integrated circuit design concepts (ex. ADC’s, DAC’s) Software development processes (ex. devOps, Agile methodology, Atlassian JIRA / Confluence) Terrestrial or satellite radio broadcast transmitter or receivers (ex. AM / FM / HD Radio / DAB / DRM / XM / Sirius / OFDM, analog or digital demodulation) Audio measurements, Audio system design (ex. SINAD, THD); Audio DSP Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Requisition ID: 69997 Ceramic Process Engineer - Adamstown, MD The Process Engineering team at Skyworks RF Ceramics in Adamstown, Maryland is responsible for developing and manufacturing Advanced Technical Ceramic Materials and Products for a variety of Applications and Industries, including 5G Communications, Aerospace, Military & Defense, Battery Technology, Medical and several other advanced technologies. The Process Engineering team works closely with the Advanced Technology Development team to develop new Materials to support these technology sectors and with the Manufacturing Operations team to deliver world-class quality products to the market. We are seeking an entry level or experienced Materials / Ceramic Engineer to join our Process Engineering team and play a critical role in support of the development and manufacture of advanced technical ceramic materials and products. Job Responsibilities Develop new or enhanced Ceramic processes related to specific areas of manufacturing such as Ceramic Powder synthesis and Powder Processing, Ceramic Body Forming, Ceramic Sintering, and Post Foundry production operations to provide products that meet form, fit and function for our customers. Will define and/or recommend Processing or handling equipment requirements and specifications, and reviews processing techniques and methods applied in the manufacture, fabrication, and evaluation of Ceramic products. May be requested to be involved in any part of the manufacturing cycle or development of product. Will coordinate the design requirements and collaborates with Product Development and Engineering, Sales, Quality to ensure processing and production capabilities Compile and evaluate material characteristics and electrical test data to determine appropriate limits and variables for process or material specifications and may conceive and plan projects involving definition and selection of new concepts, equipment technology, tooling and tooling design, kiln and firing techniques and associated refractory materials. Implement improvements, make process changes through established change controls, and ensures the processes meet required yields and material performance requirements. Responsible for defining and establishing Process Documentation, including Work Instructions and Process Controls. Will collaborate with the Manufacturing teams to support required KPIs, Goals and Objectives and makes Problem Solving a priority for Manufacturing support. Qualifications BS or MS in Ceramic Engineering, Materials Science, Physics, Chemistry, or other related Engineering disciplines At least 5 years of experience in Process Engineering and Manufacturing, preferably in Ceramics or other advanced Materials The ideal candidate with have Ceramic Process and Manufacturing experience Core Engineering principles; Detail oriented and Metrics driven Team player with strong process understanding and process improvement capabilities Six Sigma or other problem-solving methodologies and experience Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69514 Data Engineer Co-Op Job Overview We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our characterization engineering team. The hire will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our current data processing apps and scripts. The ideal candidate is a professional with data processing experience and RF electronic measurements exposure. The Data Engineer will support our test engineers by building data analytics, report generation, and visualization apps. Responsibilities For Data Engineer Analyze large amounts of datasets being generated by our different test software platforms Implement summaries, validation, and visualizations that help the engineers to confirm test integrity/quality Build analytics tools that extract information from excel, CSV, text, and databases to generate statistical analysis, reports, summaries, and visualizations. Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency, and workload management. Experience with building UI using Python or Matlab A successful history of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large, disconnected datasets. Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment. We are looking for a candidate with experience in a Data Engineer role, who has attained a Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems, or another quantitative field. They should also have experience using the following software/tools: Experience with relational SQL (MySQL) and NoSQL (Mongo) databases. Experience with scripting languages: Python, R, Matlab, etc. Experience with Python libraries such as pandas, scipy, numpy, pysimplegui, etc Experience with Power BI for building interactive dashboards and publishing via MS Teams Process oriented with excellent documentation skills Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills Excellent oral and written communication skills with a keen sense of customer service Experience designing, building, and maintaining data processing systems Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Familiarity with electromagnetic (EM) simulation CAD tools, as well as hands-on experience with both time and frequency domain circuit simulators, such as ADS (Momentum, FEM), Cadence (EMX, Spectre), or HFSS. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together can change the way the world communicates. Requisition ID: 69423 Job Description External Job Title: Design Verification Mixed Signal 2023 Intern About The Business Unit The Skyworks DAS/AIS teams is designing the most advanced next generation System-on-Chip solutions targeted for consumer audio electronics applications such as wired/wireless gaming headsets, wireless gaming controllers and ultra-low power mobile audio devices. Our semiconductor devices are highly integrated mixed-signal audio processing SoC’s which combine breakthrough ultra-low power analog circuits, high-efficiency power management and custom hardware accelerators for smart acoustic signal processing and AI features. Our proprietary technology achieves the highest level of integration in the industry and sets a new performance standard for low power consumption in a minimal footprint. Position Summary You will work alongside a dedicated team of engineers who are responsible for verifying the design intent of analog circuits in a mixed-signal SoC (system on chip) prior to silicon fabrication. You will learn the techniques used in industry today to verify these complex systems using a variety of techniques. Responsibilities By the end of your experience with Skyworks you will be exposed to one or more of the following areas: Investigate methodologies for verifying mixed-signal circuits Creating abstract models of analog circuits using SystemVerilog Developing test scenarios for analog systems Using analytical methods to verify mixed signal design functionality Writing scripts in languages such as Perl or Python Qualification and Education Requirements Existing student with BSEE completing graduate (MSEE) degree Basic understanding of analog circuits (PLLs, ADC, DAC, LDO) Excellent written and verbal technical communication skills Professional, team oriented and self-driven Verification mindset – Curiosity, Persistence, Creativity, Organization Preferred Skills Familiarity with SPICE simulators Familiarity with the Cadence Virtuoso suite of tools Proficient in scripting languages (TCL, Csh) Industry or academic experience using SystemVerilog in mixed-signal simulations Why join us? We passionately believe that by working at Skyworks Audio Solutions, you will be joining the brightest, most diverse and ambitious talent in the Semiconductor Industry. You will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on execution, global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and want to invite you to be part of a team of talented individuals who together can change the way the world communicates. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69452 Job Description About Business Unit  We are Skyworks Solutions. We are the leading provider of silicon, software, and solutions for a smarter, more connected world. We hire the most innovative talent in the world to solve the industry’s toughest problems, providing our customers with significant advantages in performance, energy savings, connectivity, and design simplicity. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Skyworks’ Broadcast Division is focused on creating solutions (hardware and firmware) for analog and digital broadcast radio reception products. Position Summary As a DevOps Engineer Summer Intern you will work with the DevOps team you participate in the build out of core infrastructure. You will work with all of our core infrastructure tools including Bitbucket, Jenkins, Git, and JIRA. Responsibilities Participate in team meetings Work on projects within the core infrastructure Support program requests Manage your work in JIRA Qualifications And Education Requirements BS/MS ECE/CE major Must complete junior year by 5/2023 Preferred Skills Coding Python, Java, C# or similar Experience with Git or other modern source control tools Must have good written and verbal communication skills Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 66401 Job Description Seeking an experienced Digital design engineer developing complex mixed-signal ICs for EVs, Industrial Control, Industrial Power, Isolation, and other Infrastructure applications. This role will be part of the design group that is at the forefront of the EV revolution, working to develop technologies that will revolutionize vehicles and enable new levels of power efficiency. Candidate will take a supporting or leading role depending on experience relative to other team members, but regardless of experience level, candidate will be involved in all aspects of the design process from system conceptualization to mass production. For example, candidate will participate in digital system architecture, block- and system-level RTL design/coding, algorithm and firmware development, digital circuit back-end (e.g. synthesis, timing closure, P&R preparation, scan insertion), digital design verification, and full-chip mixed-signal verification. Responsibilities will also include detailed documentation, test vector development, lab test and evaluation, customer support, and other activities as required to achieve high-volume production. Responsibilities Derive requirements and architecture for Digital sub system from product specification and requirements Develops innovative new designs for patenting or protecting as trade secrets Participates and contributes to product definition Interface with analog design teams to understand the interface requirements between analog and digital domains Work with the team members to fine-tune the overall design leading to efficient implementation and verification cycles Creates good documentation and reports on design results through design reviews Attends design reviews to provide input and learn from other designers’ experiences Research design techniques through technical publications and seminars Experience Minimum Requirements MS + 3 years of digital IC design experience, higher degree may reduce the work experience Strong motivation to contribute to all facets of chip design from conceptualization to release to production Working knowledge of digital IC circuit design in an HDL synthesis environment Ability to develop RTL code and understand how RTL will map to gate-level structures Knowledge of scripting/language (Python, PERL, shell, TCL) Experience with modeling analog blocks to include in a HDL mixed mode simulation Deep understanding of the digital design flow from architecture through RTL design, verification, synthesis, timing closure, P&R preparation and scan insertion Good verbal and written communication skills, positive attitude, desire to learn, and willingness to work on a team Additional skills (one or more of these are highly desirable) Competence in high-level languages (e.g. Matlab, C), scripting languages (e.g. Tcl, Perl, Python, SKILL), and version control systems (e.g. SVN, SOS) Working knowledge of System Verilog and/or UVM Experience with digital design verification, and full-chip mixed-signal verification Experience with digital IO interfaces such at SPI, I2C etc. Competence in exploring digital and system/architecture trade-offs such as memory size (ROM, RAM, FLASH, OTP, cache), clock speed, multiple clock domains, and the necessity for dedicated logic and DSP Experience with both digital front end and back end tools Familiarity with DSP techniques and algorithms Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Requisition ID: 69412 Job Description Digital design student intern engineer developing complex mixed-signal ICs for frequency control, clock generation, network synchronization, and other timing applications. Candidate will have an opportunity to be involved in all aspects of the design process from system conceptualization to mass production. For example, candidate will participate in digital system architecture, block- and system-level RTL design/coding, algorithm and firmware development, digital circuit back-end (e.g. synthesis, timing closure, P&R preparation, scan insertion), firmware development (some ICs include embedded processors), digital design verification, and full-chip mixed-signal verification. Responsibilities will also include detailed documentation, test vector development, lab test and evaluation, customer support, and other activities as required for the achievement of high volume production. Responsibilities Digital design specification, design, analysis, and HDL (Verilog) coding Behavioral modeling of analog and mixed signal circuits Digital back-end: synthesis, physical implementation (prep for P&R), static timing, scan insertion, etc. Verification of digital sub-systems, mixed-signal sub-systems, and the entire chip using a combination of digital models/RTL, firmware, and behavioral models. Test bench development Validation of silicon functionality, behavior, and performance Education Requirements MS in Electrical Engineering Minimum Requirements Strong motivation to contribute to all facets of chip design from conceptualization to release to production Working knowledge of digital IC circuit design in an HDL synthesis environment Working knowledge of digital verification and testing techniques Good verbal and written communication skills, positive attitude, desire to learn, and willingness to work on a team Working knowledge of UNIX operating systems Additional skills (one or more of these are highly desirable) Experience with digital design at geometries ranging from 130-40 nm Experience with digital IO interfaces such at I2C, SPI, etc. Competence in high-level languages (e.g. Matlab, C), scripting languages (e.g. Tcl, Perl, Python, SKILL), and version control systems (e.g. SVN, SOS) Working knowledge of System Verilog and/or UVM Experience leading a team of digital designers, either formally or informally Experience with embedded processor design and firmware/software development, especially for 8051 or ARM cores Competence in exploring digital and firmware system/architecture trade-offs such as memory size (ROM, RAM, FLASH, OTP, cache), clock speed, multiple clock domains, and the necessity for dedicated logic and DSP Experience with memory generators and MBIST Low power design and implementation techniques Familiarity with DSP techniques and algorithms Experience with Phase-locked-loops, Frequency Synthesizers or CDR circuits. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69581 Job Description Digital Design Summer Internship About The Business Unit Join a world class mixed-signal design team, building the next generation of audio ICs for consumer electronics products. Our team has all aspects of hardware, software and system design, and is a great place to gain experience in IC development. Position Summary You will be responsible for pre- and post-silicon testing, data collection, characterization, and reporting. This will include developing test systems, scripting, debugging, and documentation. Expect to collaborate with other team members and review your findings regularly with the group. Qualification & Education Requirements Candidates must be enrolled in an engineering or science education program. We will not consider candidates who are graduating prior to August 2023. Requisition ID: 68700 Job Description This Product Market leader with drive the market research, product definition and roadmap of solutions addressing next generation True Wireless Audio, Gaming and Theatre Grade multi-point audio solutions leveraging acoustic focused AI capabilities, world class mixed-signal circuit design and advanced process and package technologies developed at Skyworks. Requires thorough knowledge of audio signal chains in a variety segments like Consumer Devices, Home Automation, Gaming, Wearables and Automotive Infotainment. Working knowledge of wireless audio solutions, MEMS process and acoustics are a plus. Prior experience supporting Tier 1 customers in the consumer market is also a plus. This person will work closely with the dedicated engineering teams responsible for analog/mixed-signal and digital design, system architecture, applications engineering as well as test engineering and silicon evaluation groups. Responsibilities Will Include, But Not Be Limited To Overall market segment strategy and business planning Drive new product roadmap and definition ensuring that product justifications are well researched, justified and structured to gain maximum ROI for Skyworks and market penetration growth Product proposals/business cases to support the audio roadmap Set Roadmaps and business direction, be involved in customer / market development activities through a close working relationship with sales Strategic business planning including R&D investment recommendations through TAM/SAM modeling, competitive benchmarking and market trend and dynamics monitoring Defining and drive account strategies for your customer base; driving engagement through the discovery, evaluation, negotiation and design win process Be the face of the Broad Markets Marketing team to the field sales team, customers, and business units Set goals & KPIs to monitor progress and measure success Sales Training Material Generation and Presentation Work Across Corporate Functions And Business Units, As Required The ideal candidate is a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with multiple competing priorities and who finds satisfaction in being accountable to accomplishing results quickly and accurately. Experience with mixed-signal, SOC based embedded semiconductor solution marketing is a must. Position Requirements BS in Electrical Engineering or related engineering field, MBA or financial analytics exposure 15+ years of product marketing of embedded SoC and firmware solutions 5 years of audio SoC and custom audio solution product marketing Well versed in audio technologies (Microcontrollers and mixed-signal transceivers and radios, DSP signal conditioning, AI/TensorFlow, MEMS, and audio amplifiers) Proven track record of supporting audio solutions in Consumer and/or Industrial and/or Automotive Segments at Tier 1 customers Team player mentality & self-motivated Strong sense of customer orientation and effectiveness Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Ability to work well collaboratively with all levels of internal management and staff, Demonstrated ability to confront tough issues and contribute to collaborative solutions. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 67139 Sr. Director, OSAT The Technology and Manufacturing Group (TMG) at Skyworks is responsible for the development of all core technologies, operations, and quality while driving strategic enhancements in the way that Skyworks leverages vertical integration capabilities and manufacturing investments. TMG encompasses research and development, central engineering, quality, manufacturing, sourcing, and supply chain with the mission of building manufacturability into new technologies from inception. The organization is spearheading leading-edge industrial automation, best practices and analytics into all aspects of the operation and addresses the crucial demand for timely and flawless introduction of new technologies. Overall Objectives The Sr Director, Sourcing provides overall leadership to our OSAT sourcing function including direct materials and services. Responsibilities Responsible for developing and leading a team of sourcing professionals Accountability to drive category supplier strategy development and to implement operating plans and budgets Identify and execute value generation initiatives Maintain and improve procurement policies, procedures, and systems Communicate and coordinate with business units and senior management including insightful analytics to support improved cost reduction and business decisions Actively participate in the senior leadership team to drive a strategic procurement culture across Skyworks Prioritize and execute an evolving portfolio of strategic sourcing initiatives to drive cost reduction and ensure capacity and supply continuity Enable achievement of business unit objectives and of goals of the organization Work with business leaders to develop a comprehensive approach to sourcing and spend management Assess external market trends and conditions to identify opportunities and risks in supply categories Develop, negotiate, and manage contracts reflecting the results of sourcing initiatives including achievement of key terms Manage market and supply risks with appropriate legal terms and conditions Manage the contract approval and exception processes Educate end users about new contracts; track and ensure compliance Establish and maintain world‐class supplier development and relationship management practices Implement procedures for reviewing supplier performance against contracted obligations/service levels and business expectations Ensure sourcing teams anticipate and minimize performance issues via creation, monitoring, and reporting of key performance indicators (KPIs) Identify root causes when performance issues emerge and drive to efficient resolution by working across both internal and external stakeholders Ensure process integrity through compliance with internal policies and controls Guarantee compliance to laws, regulations, and ethical standards set by the company and government authorities Basic Qualifications 10+ years of strategic sourcing and supplier relations experience and 5+ years leading strategic operations teams in a Director role for a $2B+ company Existing working relationships and history with OSATs and key direct assembly material suppliers and the ability to establish relationships are essential. Extensive experience with new product development processes and teams, including the ability to establish early visibility of the new product requirements and planning for their impact on the supply chain Track record of year‐over‐year delivery of distinctive value from strategic supply chain activities Demonstrated success in managing internal customers; skilled at developing stakeholder relationships and effective communications for input and alignment Excellent communication skills, including written, verbal and presentation skills; comfortable and credible with both internal stakeholders and external audiences Excellent negotiation skills; Excellent understanding of contract negotiation, development, and law Extensive knowledge of risk‐management strategies Strong leadership abilities toward the development of a strong team Stay involved in wide ranging planning cycles from short term to multi-year sourcing activities Drive sourcing performance efficiency, capability and capacity optimization Set targets and deliver business results including productivity, working capital improvement, supplier performance (quality and delivery) Strong collaborator, able to manage interdepartmental communication and documentation Experience leading strategic sourcing and procurement operations both domestic, in a high-volume semiconductor or related environment Preferred Qualifications Strong financial, quantitative, and analytical skills MBA or MA with CPCM preferred Requirements Job Responsibilities Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69360 Job Summary As a DSP Firmware Engineering Intern, you will work on firmware and software simulations (C/C++ and MATLAB) to develop and evaluate new features and algorithms with MATLAB simulation for automotive radio products. The focus will be on DAB,DRM,CDR standards. Candidates will be asked to describe their knowledge in communications and signal processing algorithms and show their SW skills. Position Responsibilities Work with senior DSP firmware engineers to learn the existing modem simulations Understand how input parameters affect simulation results Refine, design and implementation of DSP & communication algorithms Document the results and being able to give theoretical explanation Remote work from home Position Requirements Must be Proficient in coding C/C++ and MATLAB. We will only consider MSEE/Ph.D. level Electrical Engineering university students, Ph.D. is a plus. We will only consider university students with Digital Signal Processing and Communication (modem) skills. Understanding of I/Q digital modulations, Fourier transforms, sampling theory, probability and estimation theory. HW/SW interaction, RF understanding; OFDM experience is an advantage Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69568 Job Description Located in Silicon Valley amongst major customers, the Skyworks San Jose Design Center is seeking motivated individuals eager to join a winning team in the competitive mobile communications market. With a headcount over 100, the San Jose Design Center comprises tightly-knit, diverse, and multi-cultural teams of 4 to 8 members. Every team is guided by the core principles of sharing, openness, collaboration, accountability, and trust. Personally contribute to the realization of RF Front-End integrated circuits used in mobile phones from initial concept to final production, whether your specialty is in multi-chip modules, power amplifiers, RFICs or PMICs, RF filters, Validation, Test, Product Engineering, or Assembly. See your valuable inputs directly translate into new ways of solving challenging problems, improving design methodology, or enhancing business culture and the work environment. Join us to experience all aspects of highly integrated semiconductor, module, and embedded RF circuits design, our in-house prototype Assembly lab capable of building fully packaged samples, and our world-class RF characterization laboratory. Responsibilities Power Electronics Design Engineer: responsible for the design and development of PMICs for mobile handset applications. The candidate will work with a group of analog/power IC design experts in the development of DCDC converters providing power to RF PAs. The candidate will interface with design management and system engineers to create detailed specifications, report design progress, and collect, track, and resolve any performance and circuit design issues. Qualifications The candidate must have educational or work experience in transistor-level CMOS analog design. He or she must understand basic device physics, apply integrated analog design techniques, and measure the performance of circuits through simulation and lab measurements. Typical circuit design assignments include bandgaps, op-amps, comparators, regulators, precision voltage and timing references, and ADCs. This job also requires familiarity with simulation and layout CAD tools, as well as analog circuit test characterization techniques and equipment. The candidate must have good communication skills, be able to break down complex problems, set priorities, report progress, and execute to a schedule. Education And Skill Requirements The candidate should possess a BSEE + 2 years of industry experience or an MSEE + internship experience at a minimum. Proficiency is required in Cadence IC design tools. Also required is hands-on experience with lab measurements and characterization equipment. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 70098 Job Description Are you looking for the next step in advancing your career in the world of audio technology? Skyworks is seeking team members to help innovate market-specific mixed-signal SOCs for audio and voice applications spanning smart speakers and microphones, wired/wireless headsets, virtual assistants and intelligent gaming controllers. Our advanced audio, voice, speech and artificial intelligent solutions combine breakthrough ultra-low power analog circuits, highly efficient power management systems and custom hardware accelerators to enable smart acoustic signal processing and AI functionality. Come be part of a team that is changing the way the world communicates and who is at the forefront of audio and voice technology innovation! Our proprietary technology achieves the highest level of integration in the industry and sets a new performance standard for low power consumption and minimal footprint. Digital Audio Design Verification Engineer 2 We are a passionate and dedicated team of world-class analog, mixed-signal and digital design and verification engineers committed to building the next generation of SOCs. This position is for an experienced and equally passionate digital audio design verification engineer interested in excellent personal and professional growth opportunities. Your Role You will work with a dedicated team of engineers, using the latest verification practices, to verify the digital design intent of our SOC’s at the block and system level. You will engage early in the verification process to understand the verification requirements and participate in UVM or SystemVerilog testbench development. You will also be responsible for creating tests to verify the SOC design at the system or block level and to implement checking mechanisms to ensure coverage closure. Short Description Your Profile 2+ years (BSEE), 0+ years (MSEE), of relevant industry experience Expertise in developing testbenches using System Verilog and UVM Experience using directed and constrained-random test methodologies, coverage closure and gate-level simulations Strong object-oriented programming knowledge using SystemVerilog Strong problem-solving and debug skills capable of isolating problems to the block level Experience extracting detailed test requirements from complex system and block specifications Expertise in developing test plans, implementing coverage models, and analyzing results Experience in the use of scripts to support automation (Python, Make, Csh, Bash, Tcl, etc) Familiarity with C-code/embedded firmware/debuggers Ability to work in a dynamic environment with changing needs and requirement Ideally You Are Also Experienced In Using Formal verification methods and tools like Jasper Gold. Real-time data processing systems Audio signal processing Audio performance concepts (SNR, THD, SINAD, DR, etc.) Familiarity with standard interfaces (SPI, I2S, PDM, PWM, USB, etc.) Familiarity with wireless protocols (Wi-Fi, BLE, BT, MAC/PHY) FPGA emulation Why join us? In different ways, each group within the Timing Systems Team drives a critical piece of the ongoing business success of the Timing business unit at Skyworks Inc. The Role Why it matters? As a Senior Technician, you will be the heart of what keeps our Austin Timing lab running like clockwork. The whole Austin Timing Team will rely on you to maintain our inventory of critical lab supplies, order equipment & other items for engineering lab use, modify our Timing IC evaluation boards to run important experiments, and coordinate the calibration & repair of all our bench test equipment. Your technical expertise will be challenged with assisting engineers with lab measurements, developing printed circuit board (PCB) prototypes, debugging PCBs, fine-pitch soldering, and maintaining a software library for automated PCB testing using our existing templates. Your efforts will help us continue to dominate the high-end timing business by enabling engineers to focus on innovative technologies and timely solutions for our diverse customer base. Challenges You Will Solve Assist engineers in running their characterization setups in the lab to collect data Assist with debugging issues related to those setups Development of high-speed PCBs Development of lab automation software using existing templates Fine-pitch soldering Creative problem solving of new and unknown issues associated with cutting-edge technologies Development and oversight of lab processes and procedures to ensure high quality repeatable outcomes Technologies We Use OrCAD Schematic, PADS Layout, Visual Studio .NET (VB, C#), Python, Microsoft Office Responsibilities And Experience PCB modifications of fine-pitch surface mount components PCB rework of fine-pitch IC devices that include a center GND pad Prototyping of engineering designed circuits onto evaluation boards Manage an engineering lab consisting of test benches and soldering rework stations Maintaining an inventory of lab supplies including repurchasing of stocked items Purchasing non-capital items on request to support ongoing engineering work Managing purchase orders necessary to support ongoing engineering work Maintaining calibration schedules of all lab equipment Managing calibration and repair requirements with outside vendors Builds stable working relationships with the Timing engineering teams Willingness to work overtime as needed Hard-working Other duties as required Education And/or Experience A technology-related Associates degree plus 8 years of related experience. A technology-related Bachelor’s degree can reduce the experience required. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Description PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY: Performs electrical or mechanical troubleshooting to determine problems in non-functioning electro-mechanical equipment used in the manufacturing process. Dismantles, adjusts, repairs and assembles equipment according to layout plans, blueprints, operating or repair manuals, rough sketches or drawings. Uses test and diagnostic equipment to perform checkouts. Rebuilds manufacturing equipment as required. May perform equipment modifications as directed by manufacturing engineers. Primary Responsibility Job Description - Equipment Engineering Technician Trouble-shooting and performing Preventative Maintenance on Semiconductor Manufacturing Equipment., which includes dismantling, adjusting, repairing and calibrating complex electro-mechanical sub-assembles Works on a Compressed Work Week schedule in a Cleanroom environment Competency in using Digital Volt Meters, hand tools and diagnostic equipment used to perform trouble-shooting Clear understanding for Statistical Process Control and how it applies to manufacturing equipment and processes Ability to read schematics and CAD drawings as aids in successful trouble-shooting Engages in Preventative and Predictive maintenance activities Maintain Safe Work Environment and acts as a safety role model for others in the company A can do attitude of working in a team work environment or independently. Assists Staff Equipment Engineers with writing preventative maintenance procedures and schedules Accurate record keeping on maintenance activities Required Qualifications 2 Year Associates Degree in Electrical/Mechanical Engineering, equivalent US military experience or applicable work experience. Proficiency with Microsoft Office products and factory Automation software such as PROMIS or Camstar Verbal and written fluency in English Language LI-JR1 Referral Bonus Program Reward (if eligible): $2,000.00

Requisition ID: 69742 Essential Functions Essential Functions - Scope: Work safety and follow established safety procedures. Comprehend the operation of Facilities Systems and their impact on the manufacturing operation. Monitor key control limits of Facilities Systems throughout the facility and effectively escalate system failures or anomalies to designated contacts along with plan to correct. Organize and coordinate the resources needed to restore or repair Facility Systems to their operating limits. Continually represent yourself and Facilities positive to internal and external customers to maintain and/or build trust and integrity. Abilities Needed Physical Requirements; A facilities technician should be able to exert in excess of 100 lbs. of force occasionally, and/or in excess of 50 lbs. of force frequently, and/or in excess of 20lbs. of force constantly to move objects Working Conditions; May require outside work, climbing, lifting and working in cramped areas. Individual must be capable of wearing PPE commensurate with all facilities related duties (i.e. full-face respirator, etc;). Qualifications The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by people assigned to this function. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. Management retains the discretion to add to or change the duties of the position at any time. Strong Attention to Detail is required to ensure consistent conscientiousness related to the quality of work, by performing work assignments with attention to safety, precision, accuracy, thoroughness and orderliness. Analytical Problem Solving skills are essential to be able to identify the root cause of difficult technical and non-technical problems. Capable of analyzing alternate approaches and developing practical solutions to solve complex technical and non-technical problems is fundamental. Collaboration & Teamwork with strong Communication skills are required to effectively serve internal customers, and interface with various support groups in order to establish priorities and achieve results. Flexibility is crucial to be successful in our fast-paced environment with changing priorities. Strong Organization, Planning & Execution skills are required to develop and execute, plan and maintain responsibilities, schedules, and maximize productivity. Display strong personal initiative and responsibility to following-through on execution of assignments and commitments, with minimal supervision, to ensure a successful conclusion in a timely manner. Continuous Learning is necessary to learn new approaches, tools, and methodologies to stay abreast and move ahead in the field. Nurturing new and existing Customer Relationships, to develop confidence, trust and long term relationships are essential. Must be self-motivated and capable of managing work activities in accordance with department priority matrixes. Upon hiring the first 4-6 weeks of employment will take place M-F 8:30 am- 5:00 pm for department training. Note* This role requires the employee to possess or be able to obtain a grade 1 Massachusetts waste water operator license within the first 6 months of employment. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69613 Failure Analysis Intern - Austin - Summer 2023 We are seeking an intern to work with our Failure Analysis team in Austin, TX during the summer of 2023. The projects you will work on will be failure analysis methods for fault isolation utilizing non-destructive and destructive techniques. The equipment utilized will include XRAY with CT capability, parametric analyzers, microprobe stations, laser scanning fault analysis, thermal imaging, SEM and mechanical and chemical de-processing of integrated circuits, While most semiconductor engineering determines how to meet design objectives, it is also important to understand how products fail. This is fundamental to designing robust electronics, especially for high reliability applications like industrial control, automotive markets and more. This understanding is improved through analyzing the failures from customers and internal sources to determine the root cause and with product, reliability and design engineers, implement containment and/or corrective actions. The candidate selected for this position will be a candidate for a BS/MS in semiconductor physics, materials science, electrical or mechanical engineering. Ability to work with a team and independently is required. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Position Summary Failure Analysis Technician Night Shift: M-F 11PM - 7:30AM Location: Newbury Park, CA Base Pay + 10% Shift Premium The Primary Responsibility Of The Failure Analysis Technician Is To Support Semiconductor Failure Analysis Engineering Activities, Which Include The Following We are looking for Engineering Technicians who enjoy problem solving with a practical and hands-on approach. The ideal candidate will be a quick learner with experience in Engineering support for failure/root-cause analysis on IC circuits. External Visual Inspection IR Inspection X Ray (2D and 3D/CT reconstruction) of packaged components and electronic assemblies Scanning Acoustic Microscopy (C-SAM) of packaged components Re-balling, soldering/de-soldering of electronic assemblies De-capsulation (mechanical, manual, laser, plasma) Mechanical cross section, ion milling, and parallel lapping/polishing SEM/EDX using desktop SEM Organization and inventory management of test hardware and equipment Any additional duties assigned Must Have Qualifications High school diploma or GED equivalent Manual dexterity, attention to detail, organization, and patience while often working with small ICs and detail-oriented tasks. Must possess excellent skills in problem solving, teamwork, and demonstrate excellent verbal and written communications. Capable of taking direction from multiple individuals and accomplishing tasks successfully. Must be proficient in MS Office applications. Preferred Skills And Experience Associates in Engineering or Science discipline (Physics preferred). Understanding of semiconductor packaging and process highly desired. Previous experience working in a semiconductor failure analysis lab supporting physical failure analysis for 4-5 years. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69603 Job Description Seeking a 6+ months co-op to work in the Process Engineering Group at Skyworks in Woburn, MA, to support and develop wafer fabrication processes that produce RF and mobile communication devices including HBT, BiFET, pHEMT, BiHEMT, and GaN at various performance nodes. The co-op will be working with process engineers from our Thin Films section to support daily wafer production, with tools including e-beam evaporation, PECVD, physical sputtering, electroplating, and thermal anneal. Responsibilities Contribute to process development and meet On-Time-Delivery goals by working within a diverse team including engineers, technicians, operators, and quality controls, across various shifts Help engineers to design tests and work with Operations to execute the plans Handle wafers and perform measurements using profilometer, Rs probe, etc. Collect, analyze, and present data Generate and maintain process documentation that meets regulatory/methodology requirements Qualifications BS/MS student in Materials Science, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Physics, or similar technical engineering discipline. Available for 6 months. Will not consider ~3 months summer interns. Must be enrolled in a College or University for the full duration of the position. Proficient with MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint). Experience with statistical experiment designs and software package such as JMP and Minitab highly desirable. Hands on, detail oriented, and strong in core engineering principles. Good troubleshooting and communication skills. Ability and willingness to work in a cleanroom semiconductor processing environment. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69460 Job Description This position is for a Filter Design/Test 2023 Summer/Fall Co-Op in the Mobile Solutions Business Unit at the Skyworks Irvine design center as part of a group of filter design engineers in support of high-volume front-end radio modules for cellular handset applications. The successful candidate will possess a reasonable understanding of electromagnetics, microwave, acoustics, and RF design, and be a driven, committed team player. Exposure to a lab testing setup and environment including commonly used test equipment like network analyzer, spectrum analyzer, probe station will be useful to perform the required job. Detailed Description Our filter design engineers design and simulate SAW and BAW filters and duplexers in a fast-paced team environment. Filter designers work closely with power amplifier (PA) designers, RF switch designers, systems engineers, and other module design engineers to co-design RF modules using a holistic approach. The filter design engineer’s responsibilities will include but not be limited to the following: Designing BAW- and SAW-based duplexers, quadplexers, and other filters for cellular handset applications Electromagnetic modeling of filters in their module environment Designing evaluation boards and RF modules or portions thereof for optimal filter performance Integrating multiple filters and duplexers together, in combination with RF switches, to facilitate carrier aggregation (CA) Assembling, measuring, de-embedding, and reporting on the performance of filters and filter modules Software Tools Used Include Ansys HFSS and Mechanical Keysight ADS and Momentum Cadence SIP and Virtuoso Matlab Various custom filter design and modeling applications Requirements Currently enrolled in an Electrical Engineering (or related) B.S or M.S program. Should have career interest in RF Engineering, EM, filters, microwave acoustics, or RF MEMS Should have lab experience, including working with network analyzers and other RF test equipment Must have experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69381 Job Description This position is for a Filter Design/Test 2023 Summer/Fall Co-Op (July-December) in the Mobile Solutions Business Unit at the Skyworks Irvine design center as part of a group of filter design engineers in support of high-volume front-end radio modules for cellular handset applications. The successful candidate will possess a reasonable understanding of electromagnetics, microwave, acoustics, and RF design, and be a driven, committed team player. Exposure to a lab testing setup and environment including commonly used test equipment like network analyzer, spectrum analyzer, probe station will be useful to perform the required job. Our filter design engineers design and simulate SAW(surface acoustic wave) and BAW(bulk acoustic wave) filters and duplexers in a fast-paced team environment. Filter designers work closely with power amplifier (PA) designers, LNA designers, RF switch designers, systems engineers, and other module design engineers to co-design RF modules using a holistic approach. The filter design engineer’s responsibilities will include but not be limited to the following: Designing BAW- and SAW-based duplexers, quadplexers, multiplexers, and other filters for cellular handset applications Electromagnetic modeling of filters in their module environment Designing evaluation boards and RF modules or portions thereof for optimal filter performance Integrating multiple filters and duplexers together, in combination with RF switches, to facilitate carrier aggregation (CA) Assembling, measuring, de-embedding, and reporting on the performance of filters and filter modules, correlating the simulation and measurement. And optimizing the performance to meet the customer specifications. Software Tools Used Include Ansys HFSS and Mechanical Keysight ADS and Momentum Cadence SIP and Virtuoso Matlab Various custom filter design and modeling applications Requirements Currently enrolled in an Electrical Engineering (or related) B.S or M.S program. Should have a career interest in RF Engineering, filters, microwave acoustics, or RF MEMS Should have lab experience, including working with network analyzers and other RF test equipment Must have experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
