Requisition ID: 69463 Job Description This position is for a Filter Design/Test 2022-2023 Winter/Spring Co-Op in the Mobile Solutions Business Unit at the Skyworks Irvine design center as part of a group of filter design engineers in support of high-volume front-end radio modules for cellular handset applications. The successful candidate will possess a reasonable understanding of electromagnetics, microwave, acoustics, and RF design, and be a driven, committed team player. Exposure to a lab testing setup and environment including commonly used test equipment like network analyzer, spectrum analyzer, probe station will be useful to perform the required job. Detailed Description Our filter design engineers design and simulate SAW and BAW filters and duplexers in a fast-paced team environment. Filter designers work closely with power amplifier (PA) designers, RF switch designers, systems engineers, and other module design engineers to co-design RF modules using a holistic approach. The filter design engineer's responsibilities will include but not be limited to the following: Designing BAW- and SAW-based duplexers, quadplexers, and other filters for cellular handset applications Electromagnetic modeling of filters in their module environment Designing evaluation boards and RF modules or portions thereof for optimal filter performance Integrating multiple filters and duplexers together, in combination with RF switches, to facilitate carrier aggregation (CA) Assembling, measuring, deembedding, and reporting on the performance of filters and filter modules Software Tools Used Include Ansys HFSS and Mechanical Keysight ADS and Momentum Cadence SIP and Virtuoso Matlab Various custom filter design and modeling applications Requirements Currently enrolled in an Electrical Engineering (or related) B.S or M.S program. Should have career interest in RF Engineering, EM, filters, microwave acoustics, or RF MEMS Should have lab experience, including working with network analyzers and other RF test equipment Must have experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69445 Job Description Industrial Operations Co-Op (Part-Time) If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. We are looking for a local student intern to join our Operations Team in Milpitas, CA on a part­-time basis (20 hours per week) to work closely with our Operations Manager in running the daily operations of the organization. This is a great opportunity for a business or technical student to work in a high­-tech environment learning the ins ­and­ outs of running a manufacturing operation. The ideal candidate will join us in Summer of 2023 and continue working part-­time for 3/6months, around their academic class schedule. Key Responsibilities Monitors capacity and inventory levels for Assembly and materials Creates Purchase Requests Monitors and expedites deliveries Verifies receipt of items by comparing items received to items ordered; resolves shipments in error with customs/suppliers Tracks inventory by verifying stock against databases Keeps information accessible by sorting and filing documents Performs routine clerical duties Job Requirements Candidate must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate (BA/BS) Engineering degree program, preferably Industrial or Systems Engineering from an accredited institution Strong communication skills Ability to work independently Detail oriented MS Excel experience needed Ability to multi­tasking Ability to analyze and solve problems ***Because this position is within our Skyworks Defense and Space business where we have contracts with the US government, qualified candidates must have US Worker status. This usually means they are a US citizen or hold a green card. Students on visas such as F­1 or J­1 do not qualify. If you hold one of these visas, we encourage you to apply to other Internship roles that are of interest to you.*** Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69708 Job Description Materials Analyst Intern Inventory control and management will be your focus as a materials analyst. You may also be responsible for tracking inventory trends, discovering ways to save money, and maintaining consistency in material quality. You may be required to handle inventory for production or inventory of products to be shipped to customers. Material analysts use software systems to design material and supply movement plans for companies. Predict and track customer product demand and develop productivity improvement proposals. Aspiring materials analysts must have excellent communication, organization, problem-solving and critical-thinking skills, and familiarity with computer and materials management software, such as SAP. The Materials Analyst will work to streamline the New Product Introduction for the DAS business unit. This professional will oversee the acquisition, distribution, allocation, delivery, and resource disposal of materials. She/he will keep stakeholders communicated on material status across the BU. Essential Job Functions Manage the MRP system and all inventory and resources Oversee the acquisition, distribution, allocation, delivery, and resource disposal. Direct availability and allocation of materials, supplies, and finished products. Analyze and coordinate logistical functions related to the organization’s assigned product(s). Maintain and develop positive business relationships with a customer's key personnel involved in or directly relevant to a logistics activity. Plan, organize, and execute logistics support activities such as maintenance planning, repair analysis, and test equipment recommendations. Assign locations to build customer samples Follow up with suppliers on orders Procure materials for various locations Manage rentals Follow up on purchase requests with buyers Manage various databases Required Skills Bachelor’s degree (Business, Industrial Engineering, Process Engineering, or Supply Chain Management) with four years of experience or equivalent experience. Good problem-solving skills. Good communication skills. Ability to work with limited supervision. Must be able to function in an ambiguous environment and multi-task when needed. Experience with ERP system management (SAP). Experience working in a manufacturing environment/production floor. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

jobDescription: If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Requisition ID: 69462 Job Description Skyworks Cedar Rapids design center has leading R&D and product development capabilities. When you join our team in Cedar Rapids, you’ll join a uniquely collaborative, multi-discipline engineering community who support each other working across our domestic design centers creating cutting edge products for global markets. You’ll be paired with an experienced mentor to help support you as an integral part of the team. In this role you will support the assembly of prototype engineering parts for the Cedar Rapids Product Development teams. We are looking for an Associate's degree student who is available to work from June - December 2023. Tasks will include: solder assembly, manual picking and placing of semiconductor die and small passive components, connector soldering, custom module, module encapsulation, and custom module assembly. Equipment operation, maintenance and repair of precision machines to perform die attach, SMT component placement, wafer sawing, and material evaluation are also required. Other tasks may include parts kitting/inventory, stencil ordering, and organization of lab materials. These tasks are a combination of manual assembly and equipment operation and they will involve working with the aid of a microscope and tools for handling very small parts. This person will work with the prototype team to share and complete these tasks as a dynamic team member. This role will evolve with the tasks that are needed. Preferred Requirements Experience with computers using Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook. Proficient using hand tools such as tweezers, soldering irons, component placement, and custom microelectronics assembly. Experience working from engineering drawings and markups, understanding of handling ESD sensitive electronic components, and experience working with the aid of a microscope. Experience with operation of automated and semi-automated electronics assembly equipment and some preventative maintenance of this equipment. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. jobTitle: Module Design and Validation Winter/Spring Co-op
jobDescription: If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Requisition ID: 69601 Job Description Module Design & Validation Co-op should have knowledge of semiconductors, analog circuits, RF design fundamentals, wireless systems, and introductory electromagnetics. The candidate should understand basic IC building blocks like PA, LNA, mixer, switch, bias, bandgap, LDO, op-amp, etc. Understanding of design parameters like gain, noise, non-linearity, S-parameters, stability, etc. is required. Exposure to a lab testing setup and environment including commonly used test equipment like network analyzer, spectrum analyzer, frequency generator, noise figure meter will be useful to perform the required job. The Co-op should have used a design tool like ADS/HFSS/AWR/Cadence and be familiar with CMOS/bipolar/SOI devices and models. Use of Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel is required to perform job duties successfully. Position requires good communication and presentation skills. The candidate will work with a mentor and have the following job responsibilities: Module level EM simulations using HFSS/Q3D or equivalent Block level design and simulation for simulation vs measurement correlation Tuning RF front end modules in lab (PA/LNA/PA/Filters/SW) Evaluating RF parameters like S-parameters, Pout, PAE, ACLR, NF, IP3, P1dB etc Impedance tuning using Smith Chart Validation & characterizing performance across supply, temperature & frequency Creating compliance matrix against spec, plotting results and presenting results summary Job Requirements Candidate must be currently enrolled in an Electrical Engineering (or related) BS, MS, or Ph.D. program Must be able to commit to Co-op term of Jan - Jun 2023 Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

jobTitle: Power Amplifier/RF IC Design Summer/Fall Co-Op
jobDescription: If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. Requisition ID: 69795 Position Summary Skyworks Newbury Park design center is seeking a Power Amplifier/RF IC Design 2023 Summer/fall Co-Op. If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high-performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together can change the way the world communicates. Responsibilities Power Amplifier/RF IC Design Co-Op is responsible for design and development of RFICs for mobile handset applications, including Class A, AB/E/F, Doherty, and other high efficiency advanced topologies. Designs will be Multi-Chip Modules, implemented in GaAs (HBT/pHEMT) as well as various IPD processes. Individual should have experience in RF & 3D EM modeling and simulation of complete module, tuning and bench evaluation of PA parameters such as gain, linearity, PAE, P3dB, input/output matching and stability. The candidate will work with a group of analog/RF IC design experts in development of cellular-band ICs that transmit, receive, and/or switch signal to or from antennas. The candidate will interface with design management and module design teams to create the detailed specification, report design progress, and to collect, track, and resolve any performance and circuit design issues. Qualifications And Education Requirements The candidate must be experienced in transistor-level PA, LNA, or RF switch design in III-V or Si-based process technology. He or she must understand the basic device physics, have the ability to develop and use advanced linear and nonlinear models or simulation techniques and be able to translate between the model, simulation, physical implementation, and the measured performance of a device. Good RF and microwave engineering knowledge is required in order to optimize RF performance of the RFIC. This job also requires an experience in simulation tools, analog and RF circuit test characterization techniques, and equipment. This person must have good communication skills, be able to break down complex problems, set priorities, report progress, execute to a schedule, and have strong people skills. Job requirements BSEE or MSEE preferred. Familiar with amplifier modes of operation: Class A, AB, C, E, F and load modulation techniques such as Doherty PA design and Outphasing. Familiar with DPD, and memory effects, and how those impact PA design. RFIC design experience using GaAs HBT and or pHEMT of PAs and bias networks, passive components including couplers and matching networks is a must. Proficient in HFSS and Keysight ADS, and experience with design simulation tools or equivalent - APD, Cadence Good knowledge and understanding of laminate, wire bonding, SMT components. Responsible for managing design tradeoffs on performance, risk, yield, testability and cost. Layout floorplan to optimize performance, layout supervision, post layout simulations. Familiar with implementation of on chip ESD protection strategies for HBM, and CDM. Strong Lab experience to perform IC / MCM characterization and debugging. Familiar with the use of load pull techniques to evaluate device and PA performance. Team player with a strong sense of urgency to meet product requirements schedule. Excellent Oral and written communication skills. Preferred Skills Experience in designing filters, couplers, and other passives in IPD process. Understanding of wafer fabrication process and its effect on circuit performance and yields. RF design and lab test experience including switches, LNA, etc. Experience designing several of these blocks: bandgap, regulator, charge-pumps, ADC, DAC, temp sensor, power detector. An understanding of analog design theory, loop stability analysis, and device physics. About Business Unit The Mobile Solutions (MSB) team at Skyworks develops industry-leading, highly integrated solutions for next generation mobile platforms supporting the world’s leading smartphone manufacturers. Our design engineers have diverse expertise and utilize a broad range of technologies (SOI, silicon CMOS, GaAs, IPD, TC-SAW and pHEMT) to create differentiated transmit and receive products including high performance LNAs, couplers, power amplifiers, antenna switch modules, digital/analog controllers, passive matching and acoustic filtering for leading edge 3GPP standards. Skyworks’ MSB team is an ideal place for motivated engineers who enjoy collaboration in a fast-paced environment and designing industry breakthrough solutions for mobile and 5G applications. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 70122 Job Description Principal DFT CAD Engineer The candidate will be part of Skyworks’ design automation organization, developing methodology and flows to support design-for-test and manufacturing test generation activities. Experience with using industry standard digital design tools, including synthesis, DFT implementation, simulations, timing and power analysis. Knowledge of RTL design and logic synthesis using Verilog and VHDL. Understanding of timing closure, low-power DFT frontend and backend techniques. Experience with RTL and Gate simulations to validate DFT implementation. Experience in debugging production test patterns and DFT related issues. Programming in Perl and Tcl is a plus. Knowledge and experience in DFT for functional safety is a major plus. Good interpersonal communication and analytical skills. Skyworks Audio Solutions is at the forefront of audio and voice technology innovation with our analog system on chips (ASoCs), for applications such as smart speakers/microphones, wired/wireless headsets, virtual assistants and intelligent gaming controllers. Requisition ID: 69037 Job Description Skyworks is seeking to fill an immediate need for an experienced Embedded Applications Engineer in the Wireless and Audio Products Group. This is a full-time, permanent position. Beaverton, Oregon is preferred location, but we are willing to consider CA and TX as well. Qualified candidates will demonstrate a working knowledge of embedded microcontroller concepts, basic electronics bench skills and possess a minimum of 5 years of direct experience with the design / debug / evaluation / programming of microcontroller-based hardware components or products. Experience at the end-product level will be considered as well as component / Integrated Circuit level. Strong communication and customer-facing skills are assumed. About The Position The Embedded Applications Engineer works directly with Skyworks Wireless, Audio Design, and Firmware Application teams to craft custom firmware solutions for customers. The successful candidate will work comfortably in a dynamic environment with many opportunities to take leadership roles. If you possess solid embedding systems engineering skills and wish to apply and develop a varied personal and technical skillset, please consider this position. Travel is very rare and there are multiple vectors for advancement within the leading provider of wireless semiconductor products in the world. Primary Roles And Responsibilities Are The successful candidate will immediately apply their technical, communication, interpersonal and organizational skills to a variety of integrated circuit and end-product applications. Job Responsibilities Contribute to process development and meet On-Time-Delivery goals by working within a diverse team including engineers, technicians, operators, and quality controls, across various shifts Help engineers to design tests and work with Operations to execute the plans Help staff members on process optimization activities Handle wafers and perform measurements using reflectometers, profilometers, ellipsometry, automated/manual inspection Collect, analyze, and present data Generate and maintain process documentation that meets regulatory/methodology requirements Job Qualifications BS/MS/PhD. student in Materials Science, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Physics, or similar technical engineering discipline Interests and knowledge in Dry etch, strip, wet etch and cleans Available for 6-11 months. Will not consider ~3 months summer interns Must be enrolled in a College or University for the full duration of the position Proficient with MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint) Experience with statistical experiment designs and software package such as JMP and Minitab highly desirable. Hands on, detail oriented, and strong in core engineering principles. Good troubleshooting and communication skills Ability and willingness to work in a cleanroom semiconductor processing environment Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69596 Process Engineering Intern Job Description Seeking engineering or science major student to develop a solution to reduce etch particles which occurs during fabrication of GaAs power amplifier integrated circuits. The position requires student to have completed first two years of basic science and engineering courses. Initially intern will learn the fundamentals of etch processing, etch tools, wafer maps and typical defects found. Intern will monitor defects, categorize them and with engineering guidance, develop methods to find the root cause of etch particle defects. Convene meetings with all stakeholders between the two facilities, publish meeting notes and actions. Create or make changes to corporate procedures to harmonize processes as much as possible. jobTitle: RF Analog Circuit Design Summer/Fall Co-Op
jobDescription: If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together can change the way the world communicates. Requisition ID: 69495 Job Description We are looking for a full-time Summer/Fall 2022 Co-Op who can work 40 hrs per week. This exciting position requires knowledge of RF and Analog circuit design. Examples include Low Noise Amplifier, RF Switches, RF circuit matching, Band Gap/PTAT circuit design, Regulators, Charge Pumps. It is also expected that the candidate can perform bench evaluation of circuits that includes gain, noise figure, linearity, spurious. Deep familiarity with simulation tools such as Cadence Virtuoso, Spectre RF, HFSS, ADS is desired. Candidate is expected to be a team player and comfortable with presenting his/her finding to the team. This person will have various responsibilities. Candidate will be responsible for the analysis, design, simulation and development of RF LNA and SW IPs for next generation mobile devices using SOI technologies. The Candidate will also be responsible for writing bench test programs, lab evaluation of test chips and PCB design. The candidate will perform chip top level circuit function verification. Job requirements Current student enrolled in Electrical Engineering Master’s program in a reputed University Some undergraduate and graduate level course work in some of the following areas- Microwaves and RFIC design including LNA, PA, switches, filters, matching networks and T lines Strong communication and presentation skills (written and verbal) and the ability to work effectively with other members of the product development team Understanding of device physics, modelling and process technologies Preferred Qualifications Deep understanding of RF and microwave theories and concepts, such as S-parameters, transmission lines, couplers, distributed systems, passive RLC and resonance, noise, linearity, stability Understanding of LNA design Some experience using RF design tools such as Cadence ADE, Keysight ADS, EMX, ADS Momentum, HFSS, etc Some familiarity with RF communication systems and transceiver architectures Some hands on lab measurement experience Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Responsibilities Your responsibilities will include but not be limited to the following You will work closely with PA/SOI/ SAW/BAW engineers to produce optimal co-simulation results. jobDescription: If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect. Requisition ID: 69333 Summary The Diversified Analog Solutions team located in Woburn, MA is home to Skyworks' design center for RF front-end solutions, low noise and power amplifiers, switches and controllers for 5G LTE infrastructure and has a challenging opportunity for a University Students available for a 6 month work term from June - November 2023. As a PA Design / Lab Measurement Co-Op student you will apply sound engineering skills to a variety of task and project assignments in PA design, semiconductor component development and evaluation. The selected individual will join a PA design team focused on the design, evaluation and delivery of next generation semiconductor products to Skyworks’ cellular infrastructure customers. This position includes collaborating directly with designers to achieve and demonstrate performance targets and meet schedule requirements through simulations, hands-on lab measurement and evaluation. Responsibilities Perform RF measurement evaluation, summarize, and present data to design engineers. Assists in design simulations, evaluation and debugging of RF circuits such as switches, Filters, Couplers, PA's, LNA's and FEM's. Qualification & Education Requirements Currently enrolled in an MSEE/PhD Program in the field RF/Microwave Basic knowledge of RF Design Theory (transmission lines, discrete and distributed RF circuits, passive RF circuits, RF Low Noise Amplifiers, RF Power Amplifiers. Basic knowledge of RF measurement of commonly used figures of merit (scattering parameters, noise figure, stability, intermodulation, gain compression, AM/AM, AM/PM, efficiency, ACLR. Requisition ID: 69710 Job Description Skyworks Greensboro design center has leading R&D and product development capabilities. It is seeking engineering talent with expertise in RF/microwave, RFIC design, and PA product development to meet rapidly increasing customer demand. When you join our team in Greensboro, you'll join a uniquely collaborative, multi-discipline engineering community who support each other working across our domestic design centers creating cutting edge products for global markets. You'll be paired with a mentor to help support you as an integral part of a team responsible for designing custom parts. We are looking for a student who is available from January - June 2023. The RF Validation Engineering Co-op will possess an excellent understanding of RF, be a driven & committed team player, and have excellent communication skills. Our Validation Engineers are involved in the Characterization, Tuning, and Production readiness of high-performance Front End Solutions used by the Cellular/Mobile Device Industry's largest and most successful companies. Validation Engineers are the glue that holds together the new product development process. As a Skyworks' MSB employee you have the chance to have a uniquely large impact on the success of the company. Validation Engineers' core focus is to create the linkage between design, characterization and production test. The RF Validation Engineering Co-op aid other team members deciphering and converting the customer's specification into a workable test solution. This involves both software and hardware development. In addition, the candidate will work in an interdisciplinary team supporting the characterization and device validation of cellular RF front-end modules for the wireless industry. The ability to tune & optimize Power Amplifiers and Low Noise Amplifiers is a desired skill-set. The work will include but not be limited to the following: Create STC (Specification To Compliance) Files that define all required tests Create / Modify GUTS (General Unified Test Solution) Programs that drive automated test solutions Drives Design Verification Test (DVT) testing and actively provides feedback to Design Completes the Design Scorecard and/or Customer Compliance Matrix highlighting performance deficiencies and areas that need focus Serves as the key interfaces between Design Engineering (DE) and System Engineering (SE), Product Engineering (PE), Characterization Engineering (CE), and Test Engineering (TE) Responsible for the transition from DVT testing to characterization to final test Software Tools Used Are GUTs (proprietary Skyworks tool) STC (proprietary Skyworks tool) C/C++ & scripting languages Microsoft Office/Outlook ADS/Cadence design tools Hardware Tools Used Are Network Analyzers Spectrum Analyzers Signal Generators Digital Receivers Load-Pull/Tuners Job Requirements Experience measuring, tuning, optimizing RF and/or analog/mixed-signal IC's Excellent communication, good troubleshooting skills, an eagerness to continually learn, a passion to win/contribute, ability to work in and thrive in a team environment. Possess proficiency in RF measurement equipment as well as test software development. A strong understanding of RF fundamentals, analog design concepts, PA concepts, wireless knowledge, test equipment operation and test equipment automation is critical for success. Experience in software development methodologies and C/C++ programming skills are a must. The candidate must demonstrate capability to operate in a multi-disciplinary team and adhere to project schedules. Familiarity with 5G/4G/3G/2G cellular standards and component requirements is desired. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Requisition ID: 69505 Job Description This internship position will be responsible for design and development of SAW/BAW filters. SAW/BAW filters are an important part in the integrated module for high-end smartphone applications. SAW/BAW filter design is a unique skillset which could expand a student’s RF and Electrical Engineering knowledge and experience. This internship will provide on the job training as needed. Job Requirements Must be a current student pursuing a BS/MS/PHD degree in Electrical/Electronic Engineering or RF related disciplines. Student should have availability to work June through December 2023 and work full time (40 hours per week) for at least 3 months of the 6-month internship period. The candidate should possess a broad understanding of RF analog component performance, characterization via Smith Chart, tuning via passives, etc. This job requires strong skills in EM modeling and RF simulation tools (HFSS, Cadence, ADS, AWR, etc.). This person must also have good communication skills, be able to break down complex problems, set priorities, report progress, and execute to a schedule. This person should be willing to be trained if they have no prior SAW/BAW filter design experience. Work Environment The candidate will work with a group of domestic and international filter designers performing modeling, filter design, and device characterization with the passion to use the unique filter design skillset to provide the best performance in the module. The candidate will present design reviews which are expected to demonstrate compliance to the specifications using simulation and measured results. Detailed performance requirements for the filter design will be created by the system, module, and related cross functions along with input from the filter designer. The candidate will interact with those teams reporting their design progress for the success of filter/module development. Preferred Experience in SAW/BAW filter design and knowledge of SAW/BAW acoustic resonators are preferred. RF circuit design, RF measurements and characterization, RF and microwave PA/LNA design, module development, and large-signal circuit design would be valuable. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69418 Job Description We are looking for a Summer Intern (June - August 2023) to join our SDK firmware team. At Skyworks AIS, we create mixed signal ASICs targeted at audio applications. These are highly integrated designs incorporating audio codecs, battery chargers, DPS processors, and power control systems that support a wide range of communication interfaces. We begin work with the hardware team to help define these custom systems. From there, we create the core operating system and driver components and follow this through to finished silicon and SDK packages that we provide to application teams. Our goal is to address all the elements the processor controls and simplify the task of using these parts in a wide range of designs. Requisition ID: 69419 Job Description Job Title: SDK Firmware Intern We are looking for a Summer Intern to join our SDK firmware team. At Skyworks AIS, we create mixed signal ASICs targeted at audio applications. These are highly integrated designs incorporating audio codecs, battery chargers, DPS processors, and power control systems that support a wide range of communication interfaces. We begin work with the hardware team to help define these custom systems. From there, we create the core operating system and driver components and follow this through to finished silicon and SDK packages that we provide to application teams. Our goal is to address all the elements the processor controls and simplify the task of using these parts in a wide range of designs. Job Requirements Background in development in C ideally with some RTOS exposure Passion/excitement about embedded firmware development Must be currently enrolled in BS or MS program in Engineering Some experience working with electrical hardware interfacing Preferred Skills Any experience with assembly code, python or build tools Any experience programming real time systems Why join us? Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. Requisition ID: 68792 Job Description The Process Engineering group at Skyworks in Woburn, Massachusetts is responsible for developing and supporting all wafer fabrication processes used to produce Skyworks’ diverse portfolio of products. The primary device technologies include HBT, GaN, BiFET, pHEMT, BiHEMT and Silicon diodes at various performance nodes. The group works closely with the Advanced Technology Development team to develop technologies and with the Manufacturing Operations team to deliver world-class quality products to market. Responsibilities Support Advanced Technology Development projects by developing and thoroughly characterizing robust unit processes as building blocks of next-generation technologies. Once released to Production, take ownership of the unit processes in the Final Process section. This includes sustaining process performance and driving continuous capability improvement. Support daily production to ensure on-time-delivery of top quality product. This includes disposition of held lots and prescribing appropriate rework processing as necessary. May require leading a team to rapidly contain yield/quality excursions and drive corrective actions. Participate in fab-wide/section-specific continuous improvement efforts affecting key metrics. Engage in professional development opportunities to stay in tune with industry trends, extend the state of the art and enhance the group’s technical and professional depth and breadth. Build teamwork and cohesiveness within the group, and champion collaboration between engineering groups to improve the wellbeing and performance of the overall organization. Work with Operations synergistically, following a “work cell” model, to optimize the overall performance of the Final Process area & enhance the skills/knowledge of Operations personnel. Qualifications At a minimum, a BS in engineering, physics, chemistry, material science or related discipline. At least 4 years of experience in micro-electronics process engineering with primary experience in final (i.e. backside) processes including wafer mount/dismount, thinning/grinding and dicing/singulation. An ideal candidate will also have some knowledge/experience in other process areas such as thin films, dry etch and/or wet processes. A basic understanding of HBT/HEMT device physics and common PCM test structures and test parameters are pluses. A working knowledge of common figures of merit (and the factors that control them) for final wafer processing such as flatness, thickness, roughness, flexural strength, critical dimensions, back-to-front alignment and metal sheet resistance. Also, experience applying analytical tools (e.g. SEM/FIB/EDX) and interpreting the results. Metrics-driven, data directed, detail oriented and very strong in core engineering principles. Team player with experience driving for improved process control and rapidly containing yield/quality excursions, identifying root causes and implementing effective corrective actions. An insatiable desire to understand cause and effect, and the mechanisms that connect them. Intermediate knowledge and practical experience applying structured problem solving methods (e.g. Shainin, Six Sigma or Model-based) to identify and control or eliminate root causes of variation. Intermediate knowledge and practical experience applying SPC, DOE, MSA and ANOVA. Intermediate data analysis skills using tools such as JMP, Exensio/Spotfire or dataPower. Ideally, a basic knowledge of Lean and the Theory of Constraints. Excellent verbal and written “360 degree” communication skills. Initiative to address and appropriately escalate problems to achieve rapid resolution. Ability to work effectively with engineering peer groups to influence change and drive improvements in a dynamic and collaborative environment that values lasting results. Ability and willingness to work in a cleanroom semiconductor processing environment. Ability to work with other engineering resources across various shifts. U.S. citizenship or a “green card holder”. #-LI-JR Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

This will include writing specifications, designing IP to meet your specifications, optimizing for area and current consumption, verifying functionality and integrating into the overall ASIC. You will interact and support other team members designing, constructing, verifying and programming the ASIC. You will contribute to system-level testing and the silicon validation of your designs. Summary How the Timing Software Team Works Skyworks’ Timing Division is focused on creating a new generation of clock, oscillator and network synchronization products. Our team designs system-on-chip hardware and software for precision timing chips. These chips drive growth in 5G infrastructure, optical networking, data centers, medical and broadcast equipment through best-in class jitter performance and advanced synchronization features. The Timing software team is highly collaborative and interacts with many groups including software developers, hardware designers, marketing managers, and web developers. Individuals are expected to own projects from start to finish including requirement review, algorithm development, graphical interface development, testing, and software releases. Team sizes for specific projects range from one to three members depending on complexity and schedule, so each team member plays a crucial role in project completion. This position can be located in Austin - Texas, Nashua - New Hampshire or Ottawa - Canada. Responsibilities Design, implement, test and release Windows-based software to interface with Skyworks' clocks and oscillators for both customers and engineers in the lab Develop rich APIs for underlying tool functionality: we develop API-first, and some projects do not even have a user interface component Gather specifications, architect, document, code and test a software project from start to finish Solve problems using standard design patterns, data structures, and object-oriented programing techniques Troubleshoot system problems with customers and in our lab Write documentation for user guides, algorithms, reference code, etc. Bring-up and maintain firmware for evaluation boards to control the clock or oscillator and other components using I2C, SPI, and other serial interfaces Requirements BS or MS in CE/CS, or related field Experience developing software using an object-oriented language such as C#, Java, C++, Swift, or Objective-C Experience developing graphical user interfaces (desktop, Web, or mobile) Experience developing software for microcontrollers using C a plus Experience with source code version control system such as Git Excellent verbal and written communication Algebraically manipulate variables of various types by hand including complex numbers, rational numbers (fractions), integers, and matrices Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Requisition ID: 69984 Job Description The Process Engineering group at Skyworks in Woburn, Massachusetts is responsible for developing and supporting all wafer fabrication processes used to produce Skyworks’ diverse portfolio of products. The primary device technologies include HBT, GaN, BiFET, pHEMT and BiHEMT at various performance nodes. The group works closely with the Advanced Technology Development team to develop technologies and with the Manufacturing Operations team to deliver world-class quality products to market. Responsibilities Fill the role of lead engineer and manager for a group of process engineers/technicians in the Lithography area, which is responsible for all photolithographic processes as well as metrology. Support daily production to ensure on-time-delivery of top quality product. Occasionally requires leading a team to rapidly contain yield/quality excursions and drive corrective actions. Support Advanced Technology Development projects to achieve site and corporate objectives. Lead the group to pursue continuous improvement opportunities affecting key metrics. Includes applying solutions systemically to leverage improvements for maximum benefit. Participate in staffing planning/decisions to ensure long-term site and corporate objectives. Support professional development of the individuals in the group to stay in tune with industry trends, extend the state of the art and enhance the group’s technical depth and breadth. Build teamwork and cohesiveness within the group, and champion collaboration between engineering groups to improve the wellbeing and performance of the overall organization. Work with Operations synergistically, following a “work cell” model, to optimize the overall performance of the Lithography area and enhance the skills/knowledge of Operations personnel. Qualifications At a minimum, a BS in engineering, physics, chemistry, material science or related discipline, plus at least 10 years of experience in micro-electronics process engineering with primary experience in photolithography. Additional “must haves” include: Expert knowledge of i-line photolithography and how it’s applied in compound semiconductor wafer fabrication processes. Extensive experience with ASML 5500 steppers, TEL ACT-8 and Mark-5 coat/develop tracks, and linked systems. Extensive experience with high viscosity polymers such as polyimides and PBO. A thorough understanding of 1X contact/close-proximity photolithography. In depth knowledge of metrology as it relates to photolithography (e.g. CDs, overlay, particles and film thicknesses). Experience with CAD software (e.g. Cadence) to perform new product design reviews. Experience specifying, configuring, qualifying and supporting photolithographic equipment (e.g. coat/develop tracks, steppers, ovens and metrology tools) for high volume production. Strong leadership qualities, proven capable of directing and mentoring engineering staff to achieve technology transfer/development objectives between non-copy-exactly wafer fabs. Additional Qualifications Metrics driven, data directed, detail oriented and very strong in core engineering principles. An insatiable desire to understand cause and effect, and the mechanisms that connect them. Expert level knowledge and practical experience applying structured problem-solving methods, SPC, DOE, MSA and ANOVA to identify and control or eliminate root causes of variation. Expert level data analysis skills using tools such as JMP and Exensio/Spotfire. History of successfully leading teams to 1) continuously improve process control and 2) rapidly contain yield/quality excursions, identify root causes and implement effective corrective actions. Ability to work effectively with engineering peer groups to influence change and drive improvements in a dynamic and collaborative environment that values lasting results. Initiative to address and appropriately escalate problems to achieve rapid resolution. Excellent verbal and written “360 degree” communication skills. Ability and willingness to work in a cleanroom semiconductor processing environment. Ability to work with other engineering resources across various shifts. An ideal candidate will have at least a basic understanding of common PCM test structures and parameters. An ideal candidate will also have a basic knowledge of Lean and the Theory of Constraints. Requisition ID: 65609 How The Timing Design Team Works Skyworks’ Timing Division is focused on creating a new generation of clock, oscillator and network synchronization products. Our team designs system-on-chip hardware and software for precision timing chips. These complex mixed-signal ICs require a multi-disciplined IC design team working in close collaboration to achieve the lowest power and most cost-effective solutions. The Timing Design team is comprised of the brightest and most innovative engineers in the semiconductor industry, spanning multiple disciplines: Analog, RF, Digital and Software. Digital design engineers work closely with analog design engineers and software engineers throughout all phases of the chip design process: architecture, design and implementation, verification, and validation of silicon. Products are often mixed-signal and may include analog and RF components. Many of our products also include one or more CPUs, custom DSP hardware and Arithmetic/DSP cores. The Role You will develop innovative design solutions that will be integrated onto our mixed-signal ICs to provide critical features, enable power reduction, and improve performance for Timing applications. You will be responsible for the architecture and RTL design using synthesizable SystemVerilog HDL for integration on an IC with an embedded processor system. You will be performing digital design verification and full-chip mixed-signal verification. You will also be responsible for test vector development, lab test and evaluation of your designs. You will develop and document an efficient interface and programming model in conjunction with the software development team for your designs. Experience in CPU and SoC logic design and DSP hardware implementation is directly relevant. Challenges You Will Solve Architect, design, and verify digital logic to meet critical power, performance, and area targets. Solutions will span across a wide range of areas, such as digital PLLs and mixed-signal sub-systems, analog-to-digital (A/D) and digital-to-analog (D/A) conversion, delta-sigma modulators and quantization noise reduction, custom DSP hardware, CPU (such as 8051 and/or ARM) integration and support, control state-machines, clock and power management infrastructure, NVM and SRAM controllers, memory generators and BIST Develop the digital logic needed for calibration, control, data processing, and enablement for the mixed-signal IP. Perform integration of mixed-signal IP, developing a Real Number Model (RNM) to support verification. Architect and implement cutting edge solutions incorporating low power methodologies, high-speed clocking strategies and multi-rate asynchronous clock domains. Contribute to the design team efficiency, productivity and quality through flow and methodology development. Contribute to all aspects of the design process from system conceptualization to mass production - Participate in digital system architecture, block- and system-level RTL design/coding, algorithm and firmware development, digital circuit back-end (e.g. synthesis, timing closure, P&R preparation, scan insertion), firmware development (some ICs include embedded processors), digital design verification, and full-chip mixed-signal verification, detailed documentation, test vector development, lab test and evaluation, customer support, and other activities as required for the achievement of high volume production Technologies We Use SystemVerilog, Real Number Modeling (RNM), Unified Power Format (UPF), System Verilog Assertions (SVA) based verification, mixed-mode verification, LINT, Conformal (CDC, LEC, CLP), Python, Tcl, C, Matlab Skills & Knowledge Digital logic design and verification skills for CMOS integrated circuits, include low power techniques and multi-rate clocking strategies CPU architecture and design knowledge (ARM, 8051, Arithmetic cores, DSP cores) Embedded system-on-chip (SoC) architecture and design skills Digital Signal Processing (DSP) hardware design and implementation Verilog and SystemVerilog languages (RTL and behavioral) Mixed-Signal design modeling and integration Logic simulation and debug skills Logic synthesis and timing analysis skills Scripting languages such as Python, Perl, Tcl and Unix C shell ‘C’ programming language Education And Experience M.S. or Ph.D. in Electrical and/or Computer Engineering with 15+ years of professional experience in design and verification of digital logic for CMOS integrated circuits. Requisition ID: 69096 Job Description Seeking an experienced Analog/Power IC design engineer for developing complex analog mixed signal/integrated power management ICs for EVs, Industrial Control, Industrial Power, Isolation, and other Infrastructure applications. of issues, based on an advanced understanding of industry practices and company policies and procedures Responsible for custom layout including overseeing the work of layout designers Reports on design results through design reviews Attends design reviews to provide input and learn from other designers’ experiences Sets the example for more junior members on the technical team by thoughtful use of quantitative analysis and intuition to solve mixed signal problems of advanced complexity Research design techniques through technical publications and seminars Preferred Educational Background analysis (poles, zeros, compensation), loop dynamics and feedback systems Advanced knowledge of device physics and CMOS/Bi-CMOS fabrication processes Previous design experience with complex mixed signal design problems Advanced knowledge in signals, systems and transforms Experience with end to end design flow from product definition to high volume manufacturing including support of production test, applications validation and manufacturing problem solving Advanced understanding of layout tradeoffs for performance and size Experience mentoring junior engineers Strong background in analog signal chain solutions Strong knowledge of circuit simulation tools, layout verification tools, modeling tools, and UNIX Additional Skills (one or more of these are highly desirable) Knowledge of high voltage processes and design in BCD and/or SOI type processes Previous design experience with integrated power conversion circuits (DC-DC/Power converters, charge-pumps, LDO’s, rectifiers, amplifiers) Advanced MOS Device modeling skills (noise, excess thermal noise, DIBL) Exceptional laboratory measurement skills System knowledge (e.g., isolators) and advanced design skills in system modeling Understanding of mixed signal solutions including discrete time digital signal processing Familiarity with quality systems documentation and procedures Excellent written and verbal presentation skills Requisition ID: 69519 Job Description Packaging Staff Engineer Responsibilities Develop package level mechanical finite element models to characterize internal stress/strain in packages due to various package assembly related processes to ensure high yield. Develop mechanical models to characterize the stress/strain and useful lifetime of the packages due to reliability test conditions and 2nd level testing conditions. Develop thermal models to characterize the package level thermal resistance parameters such as Theta j-a, Theta j-c, Theta j-b, Psi j-t etc. Document all simulation models, codes and scripts and present the results to broader team. Work with material suppliers and vendors and with material testing labs to characterize relevant material properties as needed for modeling. Qualifications Excellent knowledge in fundamentals of solid mechanics, heat transfer and materials science. Experience using FEM tools such as ANSYS (APDL & Workbench), ABAQUS, FLOTHER, ICEPAK or other similar tools. Experience with IC packaging modeling & simulation, and packaging failure analysis. Experience in simulating IC packaging assembly steps such as die attach, wire-bonding, over-molding, materials curing and reliability testing conditions such as drop/shock, thermal cycling, cyclic bend etc. Experience in simulation and characterization of IC packaging thermal resistance parameters as defined in JEDEC standards. Good understanding of various electronic packaging technologies (SiP, MCM, WLCSP, Dual-sided packages etc.), structures and processes. Any experience with materials testing/characterization and thermal testing is a plus. Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills and presentation skills. Well versed in use of Microsoft Office tools. Mechanical Engineering degree required – B.S. with 8+ years experience, M.S. with 6+ years experience or Ph.D. with 3+ years experience is preferred. Requisition ID: 70010 Job Description How the Timing Product Team works Skyworks is focused on bringing new and innovative clock and oscillator products to the marketplace. These best in class products are more than meets the eye with unparalleled frequency flexibility, exceptional jitter performance, and the ability to be fully customized for each customer in the factory. These products also include innovative DFT/BIST features and novel test methodologies to help guarantee both quality and reliability. The Timing Product and Test team at Skyworks is a dynamic and growing group that provides essential support for this exciting and high growth business. This work includes the continued innovation and development of advanced test solutions that integrates software and hardware design, qualification, and characterization of devices. Why this position matters Skyworks is looking for experienced individuals capable of interfacing with test engineers, application engineers, design engineers, and technical marketers to develop cost-effective test solutions that meet the challenging requirements of the various target markets. These test solutions typically require a range of digital and analog test techniques combined to insure these products perform as expected. Is this a great match for you? We are looking for a detail-oriented Product Engineers who are self-starters and thrive in both independent and collaborative work environments. Engineers inquiring about this position should be familiar with JEDEC device qualification standards, semiconductor characterization processes, and a strong background in probability and statistics. Knowledge of traditional test platforms is desired but not required. Additionally, interested engineers should have a basic understanding of design simulation, device physics, and high-speed clocking systems. Successful candidates will need excellent written and oral communication skills and be comfortable in explaining technical concepts to a wide range of audiences including both senior engineers and management teams. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together can change the way the world communicates. Requisition ID: 69896 What You Will Do Skyworks offers the industry’s broadest Timing product portfolio of crystal oscillator, clock generator, clock buffer, jitter attenuator and network synchronization products along with PCI Express (PCIe)-compliant clock generators and buffers. Our patented technology combines best-in-class frequency flexibility with the lowest jitter in the industry, delivering quick-turn, customized solutions that simplify board design, eliminate discrete components, and maximize system performance. As a Staff Engineer of Device Performance and Test Infrastructure in the Timing division, you will be a key member of a team responsible for portions of our new product introduction (NPI) cycle, which sees a product transition from its pre-silicon definition and design to its post-silicon validation and characterization in order to guarantee high quality products that meet the industry’s highest performance demands. In the Pre-silicon stage you will participate in design architecture reviews and provide DFT (Design-For-Test) requirements to IC design teams. Design and develop Engineering Evaluation Boards (EEVBs) based on product requirement specifications. Includes the design of PCB schematics, collaboration with layout engineers, specifying board components such as device sockets, collaborating with the Engineering Services organization to track the procurement of the BOM parts and the fabrication and assembly of the boards, evaluating the boards through TDR and VNA measurements, and generating a list of software requirements for our software engineering team to interface with the EEVBs. Design and develop silicon validation test benches. The includes collaborating with the IC design team on which types of tests need to be conducted upon silicon arrival for block-level validation, selecting test equipment and additional hardware (cables, attenuators, adapters, etc.), planning and assembling the benches, and developing test flows ahead of first silicon to guarantee a successful IC bring up. In the Post-silicon stage you will assist the IC design team with first-silicon block validation tasks in the laboratory. Device characterization. Including the planning of a test strategy to guarantee full coverage of datasheet electrical specifications, designing and assembling the characterization benches, developing the characterization test suite, determining the product test conditions and running device characterization across Process, Voltage and Temperature (P,V,T) corners. Data analysis. This involves post-processing the characterization data, conducting a detailed analysis, and reviewing the analyzed data with the design, applications and marketing teams. Delivery of datasheet collateral. Collaborate with the product test engineering team to assess full coverage of all device specifications, write full characterization reports, deliver final datasheet specification tables to the marketing team, and review product launch material and documentation. This is continuous Improvement role contributing to the improvement of test infrastructure through software and hardware optimizations and refinement of test methodologies, documentation and technical sharing within your team. Will solve complex system issues involving dependencies between hardware, firmware, and lab software. Develop solutions for repeatable and reproducible sensitive tests in noisy test environments. Develop algorithmic data analysis for analog and discrete data types. Teach and mentor engineers in best practices and methodologies for design, debug, and data capture. What You Will Need Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering with 8 years of prior experience in directly related fields, or a Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering with 6 years of prior experience. Strong knowledge of electrical engineering fundamentals and methodologies. Prior experience with PLLs and synthesizers as well as a solid understanding of jitter and its mechanisms is strongly desired. Experience with device characterization and/or silicon validation is required. Experience with the use and automation of laboratory test equipment is strongly preferred. Ability to troubleshoot and debug hardware (PCBs, issues with equipment, etc.) and software. Proficiency with PCB design tools such as OrCAD, PADS PCB, Allegro, etc. Ability to solder components on boards is preferred. Proficiency in the use of data processing tools (JMP, R/S, Spotfire, Matlab, etc.). Proficiency in object-oriented programming (.NET, Python, etc.). A great attitude with an eagerness to learn and facility to adapt to changes in plans and schedules. A disciplined approach to your work. We track and administer our work in JIRA and use other collaboration tools such as Confluence in order to properly document our plans and work outcomes. As a Staff Engineer, you will be responsible for driving many of the innovations and improvements within our team. You should have a commitment to excellence in your work and neve stop at ‘good enough.’ You will be tasked with leading strategic discussions on cross functional problems that include stakeholders from adjacent disciplines. Communication and listening skills will be critical to poitive project outcomes. You will drive process and improvements that are not tied to specific R&D deliverables. You must collaborate with our cross-functional teams and report project status/progress to your stakeholders at regular intervals. We foster a culture of accountability and promote a culture of creative problem-solving; therefore, being resourceful and having great initiative are also key aspects for this position. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69831 Job Description As a member of the stock room, you will perform the physical or administrative tasks involved in the shipping, receiving, storing and distributing of materials, parts, supplies and equipment. Unpack and check goods received against purchase orders or invoices, maintains records of received goods and rejects unsatisfactory items. Lift items 30lbs with ease. Issue/distribute materials, products, parts, and supplies to customers, coworkers, based on information from incoming requisitions. Prepare and maintain records of merchandise shipped. Verify inventory, perform physical counts of stock and investigate discrepancies. Examine and inspect incoming material. Store all items in an orderly and accessible manner in supply rooms, or other areas. Mark stock items using identification tags, stamps, or other labeling equipment. Clean and maintain storage areas in order to ensure compliance with safety regulations. Utilize hand trucks, pallet jacks, and dolly’s in-order to pick up incoming stock or to deliver parts to designated locations. Determine sequence and release of back orders according to stock availability. Examines stocks and distributes materials in inventory and on manufacturing lines. Requirements Requirements HS diploma or equivalent. 1+ years of experience Must be able to lift 30lbs with ease. jobTitle: Supply Chain New Product Introduction Program Manager
jobDescription: If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together can change the way the world communicates. Requisition ID: 66777 Job Description The Supply Chain New Product Introduction Program Manager is responsible to create and maintain a feasible Master Plan Schedule in line with company goals and strategies to meet customer demand. The NPI Supply Chain Program Manager will ensure alignment of supply to demand by driving production ramp readiness with cross-functional teams (Business Unit, Sourcing, Demand Management, Quality, Engineering and Factories) while accounting for risks, changes in schedule or demand to meet on time deliveries, key performance indicators and achieve the company’s stated financial targets. The position will report to the Manager of Supply Chain and will drive supply improvement, resolve supply gaps and variances as well as prevent excess & obsolete in an extremely fast paced environment. The NPI SCM Program Manager coordinates several complex, cross-functional projects with a high level of detail to a timely, successful, and customer-oriented resolution. Primary Responsibilities Responsibilities include, but not limited to: Sets up regular project update sessions with internal teams to understand product development status and identify planning risks, determine impact to supply and synthesize data into a lead lot schedule and production ramp. Lays out detailed critical path plans and time schedules, actively manages the required tasks, establishes mitigation plans in case of potential delays and implements as required. Publishes a raw material and capacity feasible production ramp/Master Production Schedule on a weekly basis at multiple levels of aggregation for multiple time horizons. Assesses demand trend, raw material shifts and capacity constraints to identify risks to the integrity and reliability of the published MPS and commitment to customers. Prevents supply interruptions as well as avoids excess and obsolescence on raw material and finished goods inventory. Communicates proactively and efficiently supply Vs demand stats update to various stakeholders across the organization to resolve any supply allocation situation and/or expedites needed. Collaborates closely with Demand Management, Sourcing, Procurement, Production Control, Quality and Engineering teams at the factories to drive MPS improvements or to follow up on concerns that might impact the supply flow (WIP status, yield, process, or performance issues). Manages and maintains backlog CSDs in alignment to the latest supply plan. Qualifications BS or BA in a relevant field such as Supply Chain Management, Business, Engineering, Project Management or equivalent. 9+ years of relevant experience in areas such as Supply Chain Planning, Project Management, New Product Introduction or related. Experience with MRP, ERP, advance planning tool (SAP, Kinaxis Rapid Response is a plus). Knowledge in manufacturing, planning processes, inventory analysis, forecast/demand. Project management experience with the ability to manage multiple projects to a timely resolution with high degree of effectiveness. Skill to produce a high-quality outcome on multiple projects on a fast paced, time constrained, resource restricted, complex logistics and high accuracy demanding environment. Strong analytical skills with the ability to perform detailed in-depth data analysis and present it into a high-level supply planning assessment with recommended actions. Strong communication, organizational and leadership skills. Ability to effectively work in a global cross-functional team environment. Must have a strong interpersonal and relationship building skill. A tangible passion to contribute, have a results-focused attitude, put in extra hours when needed. Proficient with Microsoft Office (Advanced Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.) Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69594 Job Description The supply chain intern will work closely with the supply chain planning team on various projects involved in improving the team’s core business. This person will be exposed to full cycle supply chain planning, will learn to identify risks to a high-volume supply chain plan, and ultimately methods for mitigating that risk. This person will learn best practices and leadership skills in a global environment. The candidate will work with a mentor and the job responsibilities will include: Works on continuous improvement projects involved in the supply chain team’s core business processes. Analyzes data to identify risk to continuous supply plan and ability to meet required schedules. Follows up with necessary teams (sourcing, manufacturing sites, warehouse, logistics, etc.) to ensure appropriate scheduling of raw materials to targeted subassembly and final test sites. Monitors performance of operations, sourcing, and supply planning as related to demand and financial targets. Communicates effectively and proactively, engaging stakeholders across the organization to facilitate NPI launch, supply allocation, and expedites as needed. Job Requirements Must be a student, enrolled in a university making forward progress towards a BS/BA degree, preferably majoring in Engineering, Business, Supply Chain, Operations, or Analytics. Previous knowledge of MRP/ERP and planning processes a plus. Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate data into high level analysis and supply planning. Intermediate to advanced Excel skills and the ability to quickly learn new systems as needed. Strong statistical/mathematical abilities and algorithmic modeling capabilities. Knowledge of different fulfillment models Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69805 Job Description High-performance clock ICs are the heartbeat of the internet. At Skyworks, the Timing Applications Engineering teams support both the hardware and software Network Synchronization solutions in real-world systems. This specific role is hardware focused and will expose you to the challenges and variety of a customer facing engineering role. Flexibility and creative problem solving are key skills required in any applications engineer. This team directly supports a wide range of end customers and field engineers to help design Skyworks timing devices into the end applications. As part of this team, you will learn the customer use cases for the features of our product, and you will help ensure the customer's needs are properly captured and their key performance metrics are met. Engineers inquiring about this position should be familiar with the practical and theoretical aspects of PLL functionality, jitter transfer functions, broadband PCB signal integrity for multi-GHz clock speeds, general analog circuit analysis including noise analysis, and the use of all common lab instruments including sampling oscilloscopes and spectrum analyzers. Responsibilities Perform lab measurements for application understanding studies or for end customers (jitter, wander, output skew, phase noise, voltage swings, phase transients) Design New Evaluation Board(s) as needed Write customer facing documentation to support our products Troubleshoot customer returns to find root cause of the IC failure Validate customer use cases during new IC firmware bring up Validate customer frequency plans before sampling new customers in pre-launch phase Help identify bugs in our CBPro software and validate the fixes Present a summary of project work to the team and share knowledge Qualifications And Education Requirements Student working towards a BS or MS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering Knowledge, Skills And Character Strong analytical skills with the ability to troubleshoot and debug systems, circuits, and devices Schematic capture and PCB design skills Software programming techniques for IC bench validation An understanding of Phase locked loops (PLLs) Familiarity with common lab instruments (Power supplies, Oscilloscopes, Frequency counters, Waveform Generators, Spectrum Analyzers etc.) Excellent written and oral communication skills A self starter with a strong desire to make meaningful contributions to the team A positive team player that enjoys collaborating with others and improving things to make it better for the next person The ability to prioritize tasks while meeting set deadlines on the most critical projects Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
