This specific role is hardware focused and will expose you to the challenges and variety of a customer facing engineering role. Flexibility and creative problem solving are key skills required in any applications engineer. This team directly supports a wide range of end customers and field engineers to help design Skyworks timing devices into the end applications. As part of this team, you will learn the customer use cases for the features of our product, and you will help ensure the customer's needs are properly captured and their key performance metrics are met. Engineers inquiring about this position should be familiar with the practical and theoretical aspects of PLL functionality, jitter transfer functions, broadband PCB signal integrity for multi-GHz clock speeds, general analog circuit analysis including noise analysis, and the use of all common lab instruments including sampling oscilloscopes and spectrum analyzers. Responsibilities Perform lab measurements for application understanding studies or for end customers (jitter, wander, output skew, phase noise, voltage swings, phase transients) Design New Evaluation Board(s) as needed Write customer facing documentation to support our products Troubleshoot customer returns to find root cause of the IC failure Validate customer use cases during new IC firmware bring up Validate customer frequency plans before sampling new customers in pre-launch phase Help identify bugs in our CBPro software and validate the fixes Present a summary of project work to the team and share knowledge Qualifications And Education Requirements Student working towards a BS or MS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering Knowledge, Skills And Character Strong analytical skills with the ability to troubleshoot and debug systems, circuits, and devices Schematic capture and PCB design skills Software programming techniques for IC bench validation An understanding of Phase locked loops (PLLs) Familiarity with common lab instruments (Power supplies, Oscilloscopes, Frequency counters, Waveform Generators, Spectrum Analyzers etc.) Excellent written and oral communication skills A self starter with a strong desire to make meaningful contributions to the team A positive team player that enjoys collaborating with others and improving things to make it better for the next person The ability to prioritize tasks while meeting set deadlines on the most critical projects Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together can change the way the world communicates. Requisition ID: 69516 Job Description The next few years will be very exciting at Skyworks, driven in part by the explosive revenue growth and market position of the Timing division. Skyworks offers the industry’s broadest Timing product portfolio of crystal oscillator, clock generator, clock buffer, and jitter attenuator products along with PCI Express (PCIe) clock generators and buffers. Our patented technology combines best-in-class frequency flexibility with the lowest jitter in the industry, delivering quick-turn, customized solutions that simplify board design, eliminate discrete components, and maximize system performance. As a Characterization Intern, you will support post silicon validation & characterization along the path to shipping world class precision timing products by doing meaningful work in test case creation, hardware debugging, data visualization, and report generation. Our work is a key part of our new product introduction (NPI) cycle, which sees a product transition from its pre-silicon definition and design to its post-silicon validation and characterization in order to guarantee high quality products that meet the industry’s highest performance demands. Responsibilities Setup and maintain lab benches to characterize Skyworks products Debug and solve issues that arise during device characterization Work cross functionally with other teams to resolve system level issues Develop test flows and sequencing to rapidly collect silicon characterization data Utilize Spotfire and confluence for data visualization to cross functional team members Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69307 Summary At Skyworks’ Mixed Signal Solutions division, we do cool ultra-precision stuff targeting such applications as 5G, datacenters, and aerospace. If you geek out about writing high-performance algorithms, synchronizing time within nanoseconds, and interfacing with boutique custom hardware, this might be the place for you. The work is challenging and interns are expected to take on actual real-world problems and contribute code that will be deployed to production. We know this is demanding, and we provide support and mentoring to help you through the difficulties, including code reviews with constructive feedback. Job Responsibilities Participate in the design, development, and testing of precision timing software in C on embedded Linux Collaborate with team members to get support for your questions and bugs Take part in agile meetings to update the team on your progress and exchange ideas Create documentation and automated tests for your code Qualifications And Education Requirements BS/MS in EE/ECE or similar Solid C programming skills A computational mindset with a demonstrated ability to grasp and discuss algorithms Fluency with Linux at the command line Preferred Skills Familiarity with Git or other version control systems Experience collaborating on projects including open source projects (especially if you have a GitHub or similar account you can point us to) Able to write idiomatic Python Understanding of embedded hardware peripherals including GPIOs, SPI, and I²C is a plus Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Requisition ID: 69299 Job Title Timing Firmware - Intern Responsibilities Participate in the design, development and testing of our firmware as a member of the timing products solutions team. Design and maintain the bare metal firmware for our timing ICs targeting such applications as 5G, data centers, and telecommunications. Architect and design new code. Tune code for optimal resource utilization, reliability, performance, and energy efficiency. Work with circuit and chip design teams to specify and verify new designs. Maintain and implement automated test environment and regression tests. Qualifications And Education Requirements BS/MS in EE/ECE or similar. Solid C programming skills. Preferred Skills Experience working in severely memory constrained environments. Experience with SVN or other version control systems. Experience bare metal programing. Experience with full software development lifecycle including requirements, design, implementation, testing, and deployment. Familiarity with Python is a plus. Experience specifying hardware requirements and working with hardware engineers is a plus. Proficiency with electronics bench test equipment, e.g. oscilloscopes, logic analyzers is a plus. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Requisition ID: 69538 About The Organization Job Description External Sourcing organization falls within the Global Sourcing group which is responsible for End to End sourcing management process leading to best-in-class External Manufacturing cost structure from cradle to grave. By driving business model alignment and strategic partnership, the aim is to establish a long lasting competitive cost base and win-win commercial relationships with our suppliers without jeopardizing supply security and driving best-in-class cost structure by early involvement in Design cycle. Leverage interactions with external marketplace to provide insights to BU stakeholders regarding pricing, vendors, and technology trends. Leverage business intelligence to assist the business in planning for key strategic decisions, e.g., new product or design wins. Position Summary We are seeking for a dynamic and creative individual who can help us automate/create an interface for the External Sourcing team where Supplier's database which includes data like Price Masterfile integrate cost modelling database tool and Setup QBR score database and generate interface for easy quarter/quarter comparison and plots and Commodity deck and Negotiation tracker Sourcing governance repository and tracker Responsibilities Gathering and evaluating stakeholder/user requirements, in collaboration with sourcing team, finance, project managers, Take ideas and solutions from concept through design and execution Illustrating design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps Designing graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets Build page navigation buttons and search fields Develop UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and tables) Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness) Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback Adhere to style standards on fonts, colors and images to Skyworks Corporate standards Qualification & Education Requirements Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role Portfolio of design projects Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop Team spirit; strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders Good time-management skills Must be currently enrolled student in Bachelor's or Master's Degree program in Design, Graphic Design, Computer Science, Education, Interaction Design, Web Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Visual Design, Communications, Fine Arts Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Requisition ID: 69583 Visual Design Intern This co-op reports into the creative team of the marketing department. The visual designer intern will be expected to work with individuals within and outside of the marketing department to aid in a wide array of projects. visual designers routinely work on projects that spread across print, events, product displays, large format graphics, digital screens and advertising for a global company in the technology space. Our team is a combination of industry veterans and up and comers who deliver high level results for a broad range of clients around the globe. We count on team members to branch out beyond their initial job title and as such, you can expect mentorship and growth within and outside of your core responsibilities. In addition to professionalism and the ability to produce great art, you’ll need to have a good instinct for content and copy coupled with the ambition and ability to grow with the company. Qualifications Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft Office A portfolio and elevated sense of design, color and typography Comfortable in a participatory, team-based environment with the ability to thrive working on your own Experience in creating both low and high-resolution designs in all aspects of visual deliverables Be comfortable throughout all phases of a project, from translating verbal ideas into visual concepts through design development, to creating production ready artwork Successful candidates are optimistic and open to new ideas and ways of working while delivering a high volume of creative work in multiple disciplines Ability to prioritize, multi-task and meet concurrent deadlines in a fast-paced environment Meticulous attention to detail and can visually execute within established brand and style guidelines The ability to take constructive feedback and come back with something better Up-to-date with the latest design trends, techniques, and technologies Interpersonal skills, high level of professionalism and a positive attitude Passion for the visual and graphic arts Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Skyworks Solutions, Inc. is an innovator of high-performance analog and mixed signal semiconductors enabling mobile connectivity. The company's power amplifiers, front-end modules and direct conversion radios are at the heart of many of today's leading-edge multimedia handsets. Leveraging core technologies, Skyworks also offers a diverse portfolio of linear products that support automotive, broadband, cellular infrastructure, industrial and medical applications. Headquartered in Irvine California, Skyworks is a global company with engineering, marketing, operations, sales and support facilities located throughout Asia, Europe and North America and is a member of the S&P 500® and Nasdaq-100® market indices (Nasdaq: SWKS). Requisition ID: 66712 Summary The Vice President, US Fab Operations provides overall leadership to the operations function to support two sites in the US. This leader is responsible for managing all aspects of Factory Wafer products for a range of applications in the ever-expanding wireless communication marketplace. The position will work closely with internal and external key stakeholders, regarding technical support for activities, striving for best-in-class products and business practices to deliver to the customer’s expectations, managing teams and projects across the business. The position will also provide clear leadership and vision, inspire and motivate staff to achieve excellence and mentor them as they develop new skills. Finally, this position will drive Key Performance Indicators to ensure that all projects are delivered on cost and on time to the highest quality standards. This role will report to the Vice President, Global Fab Operations. This position can be located in Newbury Park, CA or Woburn, MA. Responsibilities Functional Leadership. Responsible for developing and leading a team of direct and indirect operations staff members and engaging them in continuous improvement. Develop operating plans and budgets while maintaining and improving operations policies, procedures, and systems. Communicate and coordinate with business units and senior management including insightful analytics to support business decisions. Actively participate in the senior leadership team to drive the overall operations roadmap. Factory Automation. Develop strategies, systems, and processes to increase factory automation and improve overall performance. Focus on automation that supports quality driven solutions and drives desired reliability, responsiveness and strong customer relations. Data Management. Monitor, review and analyze data and performance statistics. Highlight key business metrics. Delivery. Work closely with research and development teams and customer facing business units to bring new products, technologies and processes to market in a timely fashion with high yields and robust quality. Ensure the business units to be fully aware of the schedules for introducing such new products, technologies and processes. Collaborate with and support the Business Unit Leaders for technology and product application and alignment with approved budgets or strategic priorities. Competencies Results Orientation. This leader will drive the team and the organization more broadly to achieve superior results in the most important measures of success (e.g., quality metrics, financial targets, customer satisfaction scores, loyalty, and cost). The ideal candidate will bring a focus on results, both program or process metrics to track implementation and output metrics, tracking results delivered in each area. In addition, through this program, this leader will ensure that this results ethic is driven deep into the heart of the organization. The ideal candidate must bring a proven talent of getting results through people, as well as a skill in delegation and empowerment. The ideal candidate will come from a very high-performance culture where results and ethical accountability have been achieved together. Collaboration & Influencing. This leader must be a good listener who uses fact-based persuasion and passion to influence key stakeholders. Gaining the support and involvement of key internal constituencies will be critical to success, as will influencing those important constituencies external to the organization. The successful candidate must therefore have excellent skills at influencing outcomes and shaping and catalyzing dialogue across and outside the organization. Credibility and integrity are critical attributes to effectively command the respect and trust of key individuals. Must have the ability to know when to influence, when to coordinate, and when to take a more aggressive leadership role. People Leadership. The successful candidate will create a sense of team ownership and urgency within US Fab Operations. The ideal candidate will create a strong results-driven, accountable culture focused on implementing Lean manufacturing principles in order to have the maximum impact on the company’s operating results. Individual development plans will need to be created and implemented to ensure the quality of the team’s resources improves over time. Qualifications And Key Attributes The ideal candidate will possess: (1) significant experience leading domestic fabrication operations, in a high-volume semiconductor or related environment; (2) demonstrated success leading an organizational transformation involving the integration of processes and systems; (3) a proven track record of integrating data and automation into manufacturing environments. High attention to detail Practical and hands on Seasoned operator who excels at building and driving teams to exceed their goals Strong understanding of the semiconductor wafer process and filters Experience creating a positive engaged culture of empowerment and excellence Creative problem solver Solid finance background and ability to manage capital and operational budgets Ability to collaborate cross-functionally A Bachelor's degree in Engineering (advanced degree preferred) Self-starter A proven leader with 15+ years of experience in the semiconductor arena Strong collaborator Experience in high volume production Understanding of international workforces and markets High level of understanding of business and financial acumen Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

jobTitle: Wireless Mixed-Signal IC Design Summer 2023 Intern
jobDescription: If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together can change the way the world communicates. Requisition ID: 69602 Job Description Job Title: Wireless Mixed-Signal IC Design Summer 2023 Intern About The Business Unit Come join our world class mixed-signal design team for an internship in our San Jose, CA office! We are a part of the Diversified Analog Solutions group at Skyworks. Our group focuses on the design of System-On-Chip (SOCs) for wired and wireless audio applications. Join a diversified team primarily located in Portland, OR and in San Jose, CA. Position Summary This position is for a Wireless Mixed-Signal Integrated Circuit Design Intern. Be mentored while contributing to an SoC design. This is intended to be a design internship where the work will be scaled to the intern’s experience and internship length. Possible topics for a design internship include ADC/DACs for either audio or RF applications, reference or clock generation, RF TX or RX front-end design. The goal of this post is to provide the intern with real world experience working with a team during the design of an SoC. The actual topic of the design is flexible and will involve some input from the intern on their desired project. This is a collaborative internship for a highly motivated student. Responsibilities You will work with a dedicated team of engineers, contributing to the design and/or verification of a mixed-signal SoC. As an intern, you will be exposed to the tools and workflow of our team. Tasks can include close communication with designers and team, creation of blocks based on specifications, development of specifications, simulation verification of a design, and physical verification of a design. The intern will be expected to present their results, in both meetings and a final design document. This will serve both to guide the intern during their project and overcome any challenges that occur. Qualification & Education Requirements You should be enrolled in a graduate degree program (Master or PhD) with a focus on the design of integrated circuits. Preferred Skills Running circuit simulations. RF system analysis and simulation Cadence IC Design environment Python or Matlab programming Tapeout experience Chip Testing Experience Why join us? We passionately believe that by working at Skyworks Solutions, you will be joining the brightest, most diverse and ambitious talent in the Semiconductor Industry. You will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on execution, global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and want to invite you to be part of a team of talented individuals who together can change the way the world communicates. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
